C:
What a blessed Lord’s day
Thou art a day of rest
A day we ought to render
Unto our holy God
If other days bring sorrow
“Tis Thou that comfort us
Thou art a day of gladness
I long to see your light
D:
Ose, Ose rere
Iwo ojo ‘simi; 
O ye k’a fi ojo kan,
Fun Olorun rere;
B’ojo mi ba m’ekun wa,
Iwo n’oju wa nu,
Iwo ti s’ojo ayo’
Emi fed ide re.

C:
What a blessed Lord’s day
We will not work today
We will suspend our duties
To other working days
Thou art bright and beautiful
Thou art a lovely day
Other days speak of toiling
Thou speak of endless rest.
D:
Ose, ose rere
A ki o sise loni;
A o f’ise wa gbogbo
Fun aisimi ola,
Didan l’oju Re maa dan
Wo arewa ojo;
Ojo mi nso ti laala
Iwo nso ti ‘simi.

C:
What a blessed Lord’s d ay
Doubtless we all shall say
A day to give our Creator
Who, six days, gave to you
We will suspend our works
To go and worship there
We and our friends accompanied
To prayer house, all proceed.
D:
Ose, ose rere,
Ago tile nwipe,
F’Eleda re l’ojo kan,
T’ o fun o ni ‘jo mefa 
A o fi ‘se wa sile,
Lati lo sin nibe,
Awa ati ore wa,
A o lo sile adua

C:
What a blessed Lord’s day
Thy hour appeals to me
Thou art the day of heaven
Thou art the type of heavens
My Lord, O let me partake
In everlasting rest
That I may ever serve Thee
With all your Saints above.
D:
Ose, ose rere
Wakati re wu mi;
Ojo orun n’iwo se,
Wo apere orun,
Oluwa, je ki n jogun
Simi lehin iku
Ki nle maa sin O titi,
Pelu enia Re.

C:
O thou God of Heaven 
Thou had six days to work,
To create all there are we on earth
And rest on seventh day.
D:
Olorun wa orun,
T’o fi ojo mefa
Da nkan gbogbo to mbe laiye,
Simi n’ijo keje.

C:
Thou ask all to observe
Sabbath day in reverence,
And thy great anger be assessed
On those who disobey.
D:
O pase k’ a bowo
Fun ojo isimi,
Ibinu Re tobi pupo 
S’ awon t’orufin yi.

C:
Our great, great ancestors
Dried in sin and darkness
They remained pagan devotees
They never know Thy laws.
D:
Awon Baba nla wa,
Ti ku nin’okunkun,
Nwon je ogbo aborisa 
Nwon ko mo ofin Re.

C:
O Lord we assemble
To fulfil Thy biddings
After six days of work and toils
We come to worship thee
D:
Awa de Oluwa 
Gege bi ase Re
Lehin ise ijo mefa 
Lati se ife Re

C:
This day is all holy
It is meet to take rest,
To worship in Thy church O Lord
To hear thy holy word
D:
Mimo l’ojo oni,
O ye ki a simi,
K’a pejo ninu ile Re
K’a gbo ‘ro Mimo Re

C:
Still more a rest remains
For all the disciples,
Of the blessed great Son of God
Oh take us to thy rest.
D:
Isimi nla kan ku 
F’awon enia Re,
Om’Olorun Alabukun 
Mu wa de’simi Re.

C:
Sweet is the work, my God , my King
To praise Thy name, give thanks, and sing,
To show Thy love by morning light,
And talk of all Thy truth at night.
D:
Didun ni ‘se na, Oba mi,
Lati maa yin oruko Re,
Lati se ‘fe Re L’owuro
Lati so oro Re l’ale.

C:
Sweet is the day of sacred rest
No mortal cares shall seize my breast;
Oh may my heart in tune be found,
Like David’s harp of solemn sound.
D:
Didun l’ojo ‘simi mimo
Laalaa ko si fun mi loni;
Okan mi maa korin iyin
Bik harpu Dafidi didun.

C:
My heart still triumph in my Lord,
And bless His works and bless His word;
Thy works of grace, how bright they shine!
How deep thy counsels, how divine!
D:
Okan mi o yo n’Oluwa,
Y’o yin ise at’oro Re;
Ise ore Re ti po to!
Ijinle si ni imo Re.

C:
And I shall share a glorious part,
When grace hath well refined my heart;
And fresh supplies of joy are shed,
Like holy oil, to cheer my head.
D:
Emi o yan ipo ola
Gb’ore-ofe, ba we mi nu;
Ti ayo pupo si ba mi
Ayo mimo lat’oke wa.

C:
Then shall I see, and hear, and know,
All I desired or wish’d below;
And every power find sweet employ
In that eternal world of joy.
D:
Gbana, ngo ri, ngo gbo, ngo mo
Ohun gbogbo ti mo ti nfe:
Gbogbo ipa mi y’o dalu 
Lati se ‘fe Re titi lai.

C:
Come, let us all unite to sing – God is love!
While heaven and earth their praises bring – God is love!
Let every soul from sin awake,
Each in his heart sweet music make,
And sweetly sing for Jesus’ sake – God is love!

Chorus:  
God is love….
God is love….
Come, let us all unite to sing:
God is love!
D:
Je k’a jumo korin-ife l’Olorun, 
Ki gbogbo wa gberin, ife – l’Olorun;
Ji okan t’ o nsun nin’ese,
Ki ‘Olukuluku korin na 
Tori Jesu korin, ife –l’Olorun.

Chorus:
Ife ni Olorun
Je k’a jumo k’orin, ife
L’Olorun.

C:
Oh, tell to earth’s remotest bound – God is love!
In Christ is full redemption found – God is love!
His blood can cleanse our sins away;
His Spirit turns our night to day,
And leads our souls with joy to say – 
[Chorus]
D:
So kakiri yi aiye ka – ife ni,
Irapada mbe ninu Krist’ – ife ni;
Eje Re new ese wa nu,
Emi Re nso ekun d’ayo,
O si nmu wa korin, ife – l’Olorun.
[Chorus]

C:
How happy is our portion here – God is love!
His promises our spirit cheer – God is love!
He is our Sun and Shield by day,
Our help, our hope, our strength, our stay,
He will be with us all the way – God is love!
[Chorus]
D:
Ayo wa nihin tip o to – ife ni,
Ileri Re nmu ‘nu wa dun – ife ni;
Oorun at’asa ni fun wa,
Iranwo at’ireti wa,
Ko ni fi wa sile, ife l’Olorun.
[Chorus]

C:
What brought my heart and flesh shall fail – God is love!
Through Christ I shall o’er death prevail – God is love!
E’en Jordan’s swell I will not fear,
For Jesus will be with me there,
My soul above the waves to bear - God is love!
[Chorus]
D:
B’iku ba pa oju mi de – ife ni,
Ngo segun iku nipa Kristi – ife ni;
Nko ni beru odo Jordan,
Tori Jesu y’o pelu mi,
Ngo gunle s’ebute, ife – l’Olorun
[Chorus]

C:
I will sing the wondrous story
Of the Christ who died for me
How He left His home in glory,
For the Cross on Cavalry.

Chorus: 
Yes, I’ll sing the wondrous story
Of the Christ who died for me;
Sing it with the saints in glory,
Gathered by the crystal sea.

I was lost; but Jesus found me
Found the sheep that went astray;
Threw His loving arms around me,
Drew me back into His ways
[Chorus]
D:
Mo sonu, Jesu wa mi ri,
Agutan t’o ti sako;
O n’apa ‘fe Re mi ka,
O fa mi pada s’agbo.
[Chorus]

C:
I was bruised but Jesus healed me
Faint was I from many a fall,
Sight was gone and fears possessed me
But he freed me from them all
[Chorus]
D:
Mo gbobge Jesu wo mi san,
Mo subu O gbe mi n’de;
Iberu so mi d’afoju,
Jesu so mi d’ominira.
[Chorus]

C:
He will keep me till the river
Rolls its waters at my feet,
Then He’ll bear me safely over,
Where the loved ones I shall meet
[Chorus]
D:
Y’o pa mi mo titi d’opin,
Titi d’ipadabo Re;
Y’o gbe mi soke l’apa Re,
Ngo lo b’awon to ti lo
[Chorus]

C:
Jesus is coming! Sing the glad world!
Coming for those he redeemed by his blood,
Coming to reign as the glorified Lord!
Jesus is coming again!

Chorus: 
Jesus is coming, is coming again!
Jesus is coming again!
Shout the glad tidings o’er mountain and plain!
Jesus is coming again!

Jesus is coming! the dead shall rise
Loved ones shall meet in a joyful surprise,
Caught up together to Him in the skies,
Jesus is coming again!
[Chorus]
D:
Jesu mbo, oku yio jinde,
 Awon ore yio pade pel ayo
 Nwon o goke s’odo re ni sanma, 
Jesu yo tun pada wa
[Chorus]

C:
Jesus is coming! his saints to release;
Coming to give the warning earth peace:
Sinning, and singing, and sorrow shall cease,
Jesus is coming again!
[Chorus]
D:
Jesu mbo lati da yanfe nde,
 Lati f’alafia ija;
 Ese, aro banuje yo d’opin
Jesu yo tun pada wa 
[Chorus]

C:
Jesus is coming! the promise is true;
Who are the chosen, the faithful, the few,
Waiting and watching, prepared for review?
Jesus is coming again! 
[Chorus]
D:
Jesu mbo ileri na j’ooto
Tal’awaon die tayan ti nsooto;
Ti nduro, ti nsona fun ibewo,
Jesu yo tun pada wa.
[Chorus]

C:
Lo! He comes with clouds descending,
Once for favoured sinners slain;
Thousands thousand saints attending,
Swell the triumph of His train!
Hallelujah (2ce)
Jesus comes, and comes to reign.
D:
Wo! Oluwa l;awosanma,
 O mbo logo, l’oja Re;
 Enit’a pa fun elese
Mbo pelu angeli re
Jesu mbo lati joba.

C:
Ev’ry eye shall now behold Him
Robed in dreadful majesty;
Those who set at naught and sold Him,
Pierced and nailed Him to the tree,
Deeply wailing! (2ce)
Shall the true Messiah see.
D:
Gbogbo eda, wa wo jesu,
 Aso ogo l’a wofun U
 Awon t’o gun, awon t’o pa,
 T’o kan mo abgelebu
 Nwon o sokun
 Bi nwon ba ri oluwa.

C:
When solemn trump has sounded,
Heav’n and earth shall flee away;
All who hate Him must, confounded,
Hear the summons of that day
Come to Judgement! (2ce)
Come to Judgement, come away!
D:
Erukusu, okun, oke
 Orun, aiye, a f’o lo;
 Awon t’o ko, a da won ru,
 Nigbati nwon gbohun Re
 Wa s’idajo,
 Wa s’idajo, wa kalo.

C:
Now redemption, long expected,
See in solemn pomp appear!
All His saints, by men rejected,
Now shall meet Him in the air;
Hallelujah! (2ce)
See the day of God appear!
D:
Irapada t’a ti nreti
 O de pelu ogo nla;
 Awon ti a gan pelu Re
 Y’o lo pade Re loke 
 Halleluyah!
 Ojo olugbala de.

C:
Yea, Amen! Let all adore Thee,
High on Thine eternal throne;
Saviour, take the power and glory,
Claim the kingdom for Thine own!
Oh! Come quickly! (2ce)
Hallelujah! Come, lord, come!
D:
Beni! Amin! K’a juba Re,
Lor’ite Re ailopin;
Olugbala, gba agbara,
Ogo at’Ijoba Re.
Tete ma bo!
 Oluwa, tete ma abo.

C:
On that bright and golden morning
When the Son
Of man shall come,
And the radiance of His glory we shall see;
When from ev’ry clime and nation He shall call
His people home- -
What a gath’ring of the ransomed that will be!

Chorus: 
What a gathering! What a gath’ring
What a gath’ring of the ransomed in the summer land of love!
What a gath’ring! What a gath’ring
Of the ransomed in that happy home above!
D:
Li owuro ojo titun na ti oluwa y’o de,
Ti a o ri ninu ogo didan Re;
Gbati y’o ko awon ayanfe Re jo ni
Gbogbo aiye,
Ipade ologo na y’o ti dun to.
 
Chorus:
Ipade nla, ipade nla,
Ipade awon t’a rapada si ebute ayo;
Ipade nla, ipade nla
Awon eni-irapada si ogo.

C:
When the blest who sleep in Jesus at His
Bidding shall arise
From the silence of the grave and from the sea;
And with bodies all celestial they shall meet
Him in the skies.
What a gath’ring and rejoicing there will be!
[Chorus]
D:
Gbati awon t’o sun ninu oluwa y’o ji dide
 Ninu iboji tabi ninu okan
Nwon o gbe ara ogo wo pade Re
L’awosanma,
Ipade ayo nla y’o ti dun to.
[Chorus]

C:
When our eyes behold the city with its “many
Mansions” bright,
And its river, calm and restful, flowing tree
When the friends that death has parted shall in bliss again unite - -
What a gath’ring and a greeting there will be!
[Chorus]
D:
Gbati oju w aba ri ile didan t’o lo pese
 At’odo omi iye tin san nibe;
 Gbati gbogbo w aba pade lohun lai
 Tun pinya mo
 Ipade iki-ni na y’o ti dun to.
[Chorus]

C:
Oh, the King is surely coming and the time is
Drawing nigh,
When the blessed day of promise we shall see;
Then the changing “in a moment” “in the twinkling
Of an eye”
And for ever in his presence we shall be!
[Chorus]
D:
Oba wa tun npadabo akoko na si sunmole
Ojo t’o seleri fun wa fere de;
Logan, ni iseju kan, li ao  pa wa larada,
Ao si wa titi lai lodo oluwa. 
[Chorus]

C:
Sing we the King who is coming to reign
Glory to Jesus, the Lamb that was slain!
Life and salvation His empire shall bring,
Joy to the nations when Jesus is King.

Chorus: 
Come let us sing praise to our King
Jesus our King, Jesus our King;
This is our song who to Jesus belong,
Glory to Jesus, to Jesus our King.
D:
Awa o korin s’oba wa ti mbo,
Ogo fun od’aguntan ti a pa;
Joba Re y’o mu ye  on igbla wa
Gbogbo aiye y’o yo bi jesu joba

Chorus:
Je k’a korin si oba wa.
Jesu l’oba, jesu l’oba;
Eyi l’orin awon t’o je Tire
Ogo fun jesu fun jesu oba.

C:
All men shall dwell in His marvelous light,
Races long severed His love shall unite,
Justice and truth from His escape shall spring,
Wrong shall be ended when Jesus is king.
[Chorus]
D:
Gbogbo aiye y’o gbe nu mole Re
Ife re y’o so gbogbo aiye po;
Ijoba otito at’ododo,
Gbogbo aisododo y’o si do pin.
[Chorus]

C:
All shall be glad in his Kingdom of Peace,
Freedom shall flourish and wisdom increase,
Foe shall be friend when His triumph we sing,
Sword shall be sickle when Jesus is King.
[Chorus]
D:
Ijoba Alafia ni y’o je
Ijoba ominira ni pelu;
Ota y’o di ore gbat’o ba de
Ogun ati ote ki yio si mo
[Chorus]

C:
Souls shall be saved from the burden of sin,
Doubt shall not darken His witness within,
Hell hath no terrors, and death hath no sting,
Love s victorious when Jesus is King.
[Chorus]
D:
Gbogbo okan y’o bo lowo ese
Lowo iyemeji ji ati eru
Lowo oro iku at’iboji
Ife y’o bori gba jesu njoba
[Chorus]

C:
Kingdom of Christ, for Thy coming we pray,
Hasten, O Father, the dawn of the day
When this new song Thy creation shall sing,
Satan is vanquished, for Jesus is King!
[Chorus]
D:
Krist’ ki’joba re de l’adura wa 
 Mu wa ri ooro ojo titun yip e 
 Nigbati ao korin titun yi pe
 A segun ese, jesu di oba. 
[Chorus]

C:
In these the closing days of time,
What joy the glorious hope affords.
That soon . . . O wondrous truth sublime!
He shall reign, King of kings and Lord of lords

Chorus: 
He’s coming soon, He’s coming soon;
With joy we welcome his returning;
It may be morn, it may be night or noon
We know He’s coming soon.

The signs around – in  earth and air,
Or painted on the starlit sky,
God’s faithful witness - - declare
That the coming of the Saviour draweth nigh.
[Chorus]
D:
Opo ami lo nfarahan’
N’ile ati l’ofurufu;
Eyi nmu wa kede wipe
Bibo oluwa wa sunmo tosi
[Chorus]

C:
The dead in Christ who ‘neath us lie,
In countless numbers, all shall rise
When through the portals of the sky
He shall come to prepare our Paradise.
[Chorus]
D:
Oku n’nu krist’ y’o ko jinde,
Egbegberun won y’o dide;
Gbati o bay o ni sanma
Lati gba wa s’inu paradise
[Chorus]

C:
And we who, living, yet remain,
Caught up, shall meet our faithful Lord;
This hope we cherish not in vain,
But we comfort one another by this word.
[Chorus]
D:
Agwa t’o wa l’aaye sibe
Logan ao pa wa larada 
Ireti yi da wa loju,
A nf ‘oro yi tu ara wa ninu.
[Chorus]

C:
It  may be at Morn, when  the day is awaking,
When sunlight through darkness and
Shadow is breaking
That Jesus will come in the fullness of glory,
To receive from the world “His own”

Chorus: 
O lord Jesus, how long?
How long ere we shout the glad song?
Christ returneth, Hallelujah?
Hallelujah! Amen!
Hallelujah! Amen!
D:
Boya li owuro ni ojo na y’o de,
Boya nigbati imole oorun bayo;
Ni Jesu y’o de ninu ogo Baba Re,
Lati pea won ayanfe.

Chorus:
 Jesu, y’o ti pe to,
 Y’o ti pe to k’ipe to dun;
 Pe Jesu de, Halleluya !
 Halleluya! Amin,
 Halleluya! Amin.

C:
It may be at midday, it may be at twilight 
It may be, perchance, that the
Blackness of midnight
Will burst into light in the blaze of His glory,
When Jesus receives “His own”.
[Chorus]
D:
Boya li osan, boya li asale ni,
Li afemoju, tabi l’oganjo oru;
Ni Jesu y’o de ninu imole ogo,
Lati pea won ayanfe.
[Chorus]

C:
While hosts cry “Hosanna! from heaven descending.
With glorified saints and the angels attending.
With grace on His brow, like a halo of glory,
Will Jesus receive “His own”.
[Chorus]
D:
Gbo orin “Hosanna” lat’oke orun wa,
Awon mimo pelu awon Angeli nko;
Oba ogo de, pelu ade lori Re,
Lati pea won ayanfe.
[Chorus]

A o fo pade Re lai tun ni to iku wo,
Ko si ‘banuje, ko si aisan fun wa mo;
A nfo lo pade Oluwa l’awosanmo,
Jesu de O gba wa mora.
[Chorus]

C:
Glory to God in the highest!
Glory to God! Glory to God
Glory to God in the highest!
Shall be our own song today.
The song that woke the glorious morn,
When David’s greatest Son was born
Sung by a heavenly host and we
Would join th’ angelic company

Chorus: 
Glory to God in the highest!
Glory to God in the highest!
Glory! Glory! Glory! Glory!
Glory be to God on high
D:
Ogo f’Olorun lok’orun,
Ogo, ogo ni f’Olorun;
Ogo f’Olorun lok’orun,
Li orin wa loni.
Orin ti owuro ayo,
Ti a bi omo Dafidi;
Ti ogun orun ko, awa
Si fe dapo mo ogun wa.

Chorus:
Ogo f’ Olorun lok’ orun,
Ogo f’ olorun lok’ orun;
Ogo, ogo, ogo, ogo !
Ogo f’ Olorun l’oke.

C:
Glory to God in the highest!
Glory to God! Glory to God
Glory to God in the highest!
Shall be our own song today.
Another year’s rich mercies prove
His ceaseless care and boundless love;
So let our loudest voices raise
Our anniversary song of praise.
[Chorus]
D:
Ogo f’ Olorun lok’ orun,
Ogo, ogo ni f’ Olorun;
Ogo f’ Olorun lok’ orun.
Li orin wa loni.
Anu ti a nri gba fihan,
Bi ife Re tit obi to;
Jeki a gbohun wa s’oke,
Korin yin Olugbala.
 Ogo f’lorun lok’orun & c.

C:
Glory to God in the highest!
Glory to God! Glory to God
Glory to God in the highest!
Shall be our own song today.
Oh, may we an unbroken band,
Around the throne of Jesus stand
And there, with angels and the throng
Of His redeem’d ones, join the song. .
[Chorus]
D:
Ogo f’ Olorun lok’orun,
Ogo, ogo ni f’ Olorun;
Ogo f’ Olorun lok’ orun,
Li orin wa loni.
Jeki awa le duro pe,
Niwaju ‘te Olugbala;
K’ a korin pel awon Angel,
At’ awon eni ‘rapada.
 Ogo f’Olorun lok’ orun & c.

C:
“Buried with Christ” and raised with Him too;
What is there left form me to do?
Simply to cease from struggling and strife,
Simply to walk in newness of life”.
D:
A ti sin mi po pelu Kristi,
A ji mi dide pelu Re;
Ki nma rin nipa ti ara mo,
Sugbon ninu otun iwa.

C:
“Risen with Christ”, my glorious Head,
Holiness now the pathway I tread,
Beautiful thought, while walking therein:
“He that is dead is freed from sin”
D:
A ti ji mi dide pelu Re,
Oma mimo ni ki nmaa rin;
O dun pupo lati maa rin be,
“Enit’ o ku bo low’ ese”.

C:
“Living with Christ”, who “dieth no more”
Following Christ, who goeth before;
I am from bondage utterly freed,
Reckoning self as “dead indeed”.
D:
Mo ye pelu Re, nko ni ku mo,
Mo ntele, O nlo niwaju;
O ti fa gbogbo ide mi ja,
Mo nka ara mi si oku.

C:
Living for Christ, my members I yield
Servants to God, for everyone sealed,
‘Not under law”, I’m now under grace”
Sin is dethroned, and Christ takes its place.
D:
Mo ti jowo ‘ra mi fun Kristi,
Iranse olorun titi;
Mo wa labe ore-ofe Re,
Ese ku, Kristi si joba.

C:
Growing in Christ; no more shall be named
Things of which now I’m truly ashamed,
“Fruit unto holiness” will I bear,
Life evermore, the end I shall share.
D:
Mo ndagba ninu Oluwa mi,
Mo ti f’iwa ‘tiju sile;
Mo sin nso eso iwa mimo,
T’emi n’iye ainipekun.

C:
Glory to God, whose Spirit draws
Fresh soldiers to the Saviour’s cause,
Who thus, baptized into His name,
His goodness and their faith proclaim.
D:
Yin Oluwa Emi ti nfa,
Om’ogun titun sodo Re;
Awon t’o jewo ‘gbagbo won,
T’a ri nwon bomi l’Ooko Re.

C:
For these now added to the host,
Who in their Lord and Saviour boast,
And consecrate to Him their days,
Accept, O God, our grateful praise.
D:
A ti ka won mo lat’oni,
Awon t’o ni Olugbala;
Ti nwon ya’ra won si mimo
Tewogba ope wa, Baba.

C:
Thus may Thy mighty Spirit draw
All here to love and keep His law;
Themselves His subjects to declare,
And place themselves beneath His care.
D:
Maa fi Emi Re fa won mora,
Lati pa liana Re m;
Ki nwon fi ara won rubo,
Ki nwon wa labe ‘toju Re.

C:
Lead them at once their Lord to own,
To glory in His cross alone;
And then, baptized, His truth to teach,
His love to share, his Heaven to reach.
D:
Mu won gba O li Oluwa,
Ki nwon ro mo agbelebu;
Lehin iribomi, kin won
Lo maa kede tit’ E o fi de.

C:
A mighty mystery we set forth
A wondrous sign and seal;
Lord, give our hearts to know its worth,
And all its truth to feel.
D:
Ami Ijinle nla l’eyi,
Ti a nfihan loni;
Ran wa lowo k’a mo riri,
Otito t’O nko wa.

C:
Death to the world we thus avow,
Death to each sinful lust;
The risen life is our life now,
The risen Christ is our trust

B’o dabi Baba ko gbo,
B’o dabi ‘mole ko si,
Je k’a fi gbagbo ri O,
     Jesu, sanu fun wa.

C:
Jesus, in your thirst and pain,
While you wounds your lifeblood drain,
Thirsting more our love to gain:
Hear us, holy Jesus.
D:
Jesu, ninu ongbe Re,
Ni ori agbelebu,
‘Wo ti o fe  a sibe;
    Jesu, sanu fun wa.

C:
May we thirst your love to know;
Lead us in our sin and woe
Where the healing waters flow:
Hear us, holy Jesus.
D:
Je k’a kongbe ife Re,
Maa samona wa titi,
Sibi omi iye ni,
     Jesu, sanu fun wa.

C:
Jesus, all our ransom paid,
All your Father’s will obeyed;
By your sufferings perfect made:
Hear us, holy Jesus.
D:
Jesu Olurapada,
‘Wo t’ O se ‘fe Baba Re,
T’o si jiya ‘tori wa;
     Jesu, sanu fun wa.

C:
Save us in our soul’s distress;
Be our help to cheer and bless
While we grow in holiness:
Hear us, holy Jesus.
D:
Gba wa l’ojo idamu,
Se Oluranlowo wa,
Lati maa t’ona mimo;
     Jesu, sanu fun wa.

C:
Brighten all our heavenward way
With an ever holier ray
Till we pass to perfect day:
Hear us, holy Jesus.
D:
F’imole Re s’ona wa,
Ti y’o maa tan titi lai,
Tit’ a o fi de odo Re;
     Jesu, sanu fun wa.

C:
Jesus, all your labor vast,
All your woe and conflict past,
Yielding up your soul at last:
Hear us, holy Jesus.

When the death shades round us lower,
Guard us from the tempter’s power,
Keep us in that trial hour:
Hear us, holy Jesus.

May your life and death supply
Grace to live and grace to die,
Grace to reach the home on high:
Hear us, holy Jesus.
D:
Ki iku at’iye Re,
Mu ore-ofe ba wa,
Ti yio mu wa d’oke;
     Jesu, sanu fun wa.

C:
Wrestling in agony, wrestling alone;
Weary for human love, finding none.
D:
N’iwaiya ‘jakadi/On nikan nja,
O nfe iran lowo/Sugbon ko ri.

C:
While over Olivet sleeps the moonlight,
Whose is that broken prayer troubling night?
D:
B’osupa  ti nwo/lor’oke Olif’,
Adura tani ngoke/l’oru yi?

C:
What are those drops of blood falling like rain,
Wrung from that heart of Thine, Man of pain
D:
Eje wo l’eyi ti/ nro bi ojo,
Lat’ okan Re wa, “E/ni ‘banuje?

C:
Anguish unspeakable writ on Thy brow,–
Suppliant Sufferer, Who art Thou?
D:
Irora aileso/mbe loju Re,
Ojiya ti mbebe/tan’ Iwo?

C:
Hark, in thy bosom’s depths speaks He to thee,
“Child of My dying love, follow Me.
D:
Gbo b’O ti mba o so/ro lokan re,
“Omo ti mo ku fun/tele mi”.

C:
“Shall I not drink the cup My Father gave?–
Drink it, when drinking it thee will save?
D:
“Ki  nma m’ago ti/Baba fun mi bi?
‘Gbati mimu re je/’gbala re.

C:
“Buffeted, spitted on, loaded with scorns,
Smitten, scourged, purple-robed, crowned with thorns:
D:
“A lu, a tutosi/a fi sefe,
A naa, a si de/l’ade egun.

C:
“Onward to Golgotha; there I must die;
All for the love of thee: it is I.”
D:
“Mo nlo si Golgota,/nibe ngo ku,
‘Tor’ife mi si o/Emi ni.

C:
Nailed to the bitter wood; never a groan:
Bearing our guilt and sin, not His own.
D:
A kan mo ‘gi esin/ko kerora
O r’ eru ese wa,/Tire ko.

C:
Sun of my soul, canst Thou suffer eclipse?
What words are those from Thy quivering lips?
D:
Wo oorun mi, o le/wo ookun bi?
Oro wo l’o nte/nu Re wa ni?

C:
“Father, forgive them,” the Crucified prays:
And Him the Father hears, hears always.
D:
“Baba dariji won/l’adura Re,
“Baba si gbo, bi/ti mo gbo ri.

C:
Listen, the dying thief for mercy sighs:–
Calmly He promises Paradise.
D:
Gbo bi ole ni ti/ntoro aanu,
On se ‘leri Pa/radise fun U.

C:
Standing beside His cross kinsfolk, and friend,
Mary, and Magdalene wait the end:
D:
Ibatan at’ore/rogba yika,
Maria on Magdalen/r’ opin Re.

C:
Two of them henceforth are mother and son,
Broken hearts by His word bound as one.
D:
Meji ninu won di/tiyatomo;
Okan t’oro Re/ti so d’okan.

C:
Darkness wraps earth and sky: night at midday:
Moments like centuries pass away.
D:
Okunkun bo ile/osan d’oru,
Iseju koja b’/odun pipo.

C:
Hark, through the gloom is heard one dreadful cry,
“Thou hast forsaken Me, Father, why?”
D:
Gbo’gbe ‘rora lat’ i/nu ooko na,
“Baba, ‘Wo ko mi/ sile, ese?”

C:
Oh that abandonment! Oh death accursed!
What means that plaint of woe, that “I thirst?”
D:
A! ikosile nla!/iku egun !
Igbe kil’eyi/”Ongbe ngbe mi”

C:
Hark, “It is finished,” Thy warfare is done;
Death and hell grappled with; victory won.
D:
Gbo, “O ti pari”/Ijakadi pin,
Iku at’ipoku/ a se won.

C:
“Father, receive My soul,” His latest breath,
Jesus, the Lord of life, sleeps in death.
D:
“Baba, gba emi mi”/l’o wi kehin
Krist’ Oluwa iye/O si ku.

C:
“Child of My agonies, bought with My blood,
Ransomed from Satan’s thrall, saved for God.
D:
“Omo ‘rora mi, ti/ mo f’eje ra,
Mo gba o low’esu/f’Olorun.

C:
“Come to Me, weary one, come to My breast:
Here in My bleeding wounds hide and rest.
D:
‘Wa alaare wa f’ori/l’aiye mi;
Sapamo sodo mi/k’o simi.

C:
“Come to My Father’s feet, come without fear:–
I am thy Advocate, always near.
D:
“Wa, sodo Baba  mi/wa l’aiberu,
Alagbawi re/wa nitosi.

C:
“Drink of the Spirit’s grace, all things are thine:
I am thy heritage, thou art Mine.”
D:
“Wa, mu ninu ore/ofe Emi;
Emi ni ini re/’wo t’Emi”.

C:
“Yea, Lord, I give myself wholly to Thee:
Only Thy priceless love give Thou me.
D:
Mo f’ara mi fun O/Oluwa mi,
Sa f’ife Re, ‘ye/biye fun mi.

C:
“All I have, all I am, body and soul,
Nothing refuse I Thee; take the whole.
D:
Sa ba mi gbe dopin/Oluwa mi,
Jesu, Olugbala/Oluwa mi.

C:
“Only abide with me, Lord, to the end;
Jesus, Emmanuel, Savior, Friend.
D:
Gbogb’ohun ti mo mi’t’ara t’okan,
Nko je fi dun O/gba gbogbo re.

C:
“And when Thy time is come, let me adore
Thee in Thy home of light evermore.”
D:
B’akoko Re ba de/je kin g yin O,
Yin O n’ile Re/titi lailai.

C:
The whole wide world for Jesus
This shall our Watchword be
Upon the highest mountain,
Down by the widest sea
The whole wide world for Jesus
To Him all men shall bow,
In city or in prairie
The world for Jesus now!

Chorus: 
The whole wide world, the whole wide world
Proclaim the Gospel tidings through the
Whole wide world--
Lift up the Cross for Jesus, His banner be
Unfurled--
Till every tongue confess Him through the
Whole wide world.
D:
Gbogb’ aiye fun Jesu,
Li akomona wa,
Lori oke t’o ga ju,
Ati l’ori okun;
Gbogbo aiye fun Jesu,
Gbogbo eda y’o jewo,
Ni ile tabi l’oko,
Jesu ni y’o joba.

Chorus:
Gbogbo aiye, gbogbo aiye,
Kede ihinrere yi gbogbo aiye ka;
Gba asia Re s’oke a ko gbodo fe ku
Titi gbogb’ ahon y’o jewo Re
 l’Oluwa.

C:
The whole wide world for Jesus.
Inspires us with the thought
That every son of Adam
Should by His blood be bought;
The whole wide world for Jesus!
O faint not by the way!
The Cross shall surely conquer
In this our glorious day.
[Chorus]
D:
Gbogbo aiye fun Jesu,
Eyi mu war anti;
Pe gbogbo iran Adam,
Lati we n’neje Re;
Gbogbo aiye fun Jesu,
Ma je ki o re nyin,
Awa I y’o sa se’gun,
Nipa agbelebu.
[Chorus]

C:
The whole wide world for Jesus
The marching order sound—
Go ye and preach the Gospel
Wherever man is found,
The whole wide world for Jesus!
Our banner is unfurled--
We battle now for Jesus,
And faith demands the world! 
[Chorus]
D:
Gbogbo aiye fun Jesu,
Je k’a tesiwaju,
Lo wasu ihinrere,
Nibit’ enia wa;
Gbogbo aiye fun Jesu,
Gbe asia soke,
A o ja fun Jesu titi
Y’o joba gbogb’ aiye.
[Chorus]

C:
Far, far away, in heathen darkness dwelling,
Millions of souls for ever may be lost;
Who, who will o, salvation’s story telling
Looking to Jesus, minding not the cost?

Chorus:
“All power is given unto Me,
All power is given unto Me,
Go ye into all the world and
Preach the gospel,
And lo, I am with you always”
D:
Pupopupo l’awon t’o wa yi wa ka,
Ti okan won yigbi ninu ese;
Tani y’o lo so ti igbala fun won,
Tani y’o f’ori la’ku f’Oluwa.

Chorus:
“Gbogbo agbara l’a fun Mi”
Beni Jesu Oluwa wi.
Kede ‘gbala f’araiye, 
mase beru,
Jesu wa pelu wa de opin.

C:
See o’er the world wide open doors inviting,
Soldiers of Christ, arise and enter in
Christiana, awake! Your forces all uniting,
Send forth the gospel, break the chains of sin.
[Chorus]
D:
L’otun, l’osi, l’a npe fun Iranlowo,
Om’-ogun Kristi dide mura giri;
E s’owo-po gbe fitila nyin soke,
Kede Ominira f‘awon t’ese de.
[Chorus]

C:
“Why will ye die? ‘the voice of God is calling,
“Why will ye die?” re-echo in His name!
Jesus hath died to save from death appalling,
Life and salvation, therefore go proclaim.
[Chorus]
D:
So fun won pe “Eese t’enyin o fi ku?
Iye mbe ninu Oruko Jesu;
O ti ku l’ati gba wa lowo iku
Kede idasile kikun fun won.
[Chorus]

C:
God spreed the, when those of ev’ry nation,
“Glory to God” triumphantly shall sing,
Ransomed, redeemed, rejoicing in salvation,
Shout “Halleluyah, for the Lord is King!”
[Chorus]
D:
Baba, je ki ojo nla na yara de,
Ti gbogb’aiye y’o maa f’ogo fun O
Ti gbogbo wa y’o yo ayo igbala,
T’ao si ko “Halleluya” s’Oba wa.
[Chorus]

C:
Tell the whole wide world of Jesus,
Bear the news from shore to shore;
Telling sinners of the Saviour
Let the Light spread more and more.

Chorus: 
Tell the world, the whole wide world,
Bear the news from shore to shore,
Tell the whole wide world of Jesus
Praise His name for evermore!
D:
Kede Jesu yi aiye ka,
Lo lati ilu de ‘lu,
So t’Olugbala f’elese,
Tan imole na kikan.

Chorus:
 Kede Re yi aiye ka,
 Lo lati ile de ‘lu;
 So ti Jesu fun gbogb’aiye,
Yin Oruko Re titi.

C:
Send abroad the gospel heralds,
Let them take the blessed light
Into every land of darkness,
Piercing through the shades of night.
[Chorus]
D:
Tan ihin ayo na kale,
Fi imole na han won;
Si gbogbo ile okunkun,
K’imole le tan loni.
[Chorus]

C:
Yes, we’ll send the joyful message
Over mountain over wave,
Telling everywhere of Jesus,
And His mighty power to save.
[Chorus]
D:
Beni, awa y’o f’ayo lo,
Lor’oke on petele,
A o ma so itan ti Jesu,
Agbara t’o fi ngbala.
[Chorus]

C:
While we pray for other nations,
Send them to help with willing hand,
Let us not forget the home fields-
Jesus for our native land! 
[Chorus]
D:
A o gbadura fun gbogb’ aiye,
A o si se iranlowo;
Awon t’o wa nitosi wa,
A o tun fi Jesu han won.
[Chorus]

C:
We have heard a joyful sound,
Jesus saves; Jesus saves,
Spread the gladness all around
Jesus saves, Jesus saves,
Bear the news to ev’ry land,
Climb the steps and cross the waves,
Onward, ‘tis our Lord’s command,
Jesus saves, Jesus saves.
D:
Gbo iro ayo didun,
Pe Jesu ngba ni la, 
Kede re jakejado,
Pe Jesu ngba ni la,
Tan ihin ayo na ka,
Lor’oke on petele,
Kede re kikankikan,
Pe Jesu ngba ni la.

C:
Waft it on the rolling tide,
Jesus saves, Jesus saves,
Tell to sinners far and wide,
Jesus saves, Jesus saves,
Sing, ye islands of the sea,
Echo back, ye ocean caves,
Earth shall keep her jubilee,
Jesus saves, Jesus saves,
D:
So fun awon to jinna,
Pe Jesu ngba ni la,
F’awon to wa nitosi,
Pe Jesu ngba ni la,
So fun gbogbo elese,
Ore at’ ibatan re,
So ti idasile yi,
Pe Jesu ngba ni la.

C:
Sing above the battle’s strife,
Jesus saves, Jesus saves,
By His death and endless life,
Jesus saves, Jesus saves
Sing it softly through the gloom,
When the heart for mercy craves,
Sing in triumph o’er the tomb,
Jesus saves, Jesus saves,
D:
Korin irapada na,
Pe Jesu ngba ni la,
O ti ku O si jinde,
Pe Jesu ngba ni la,
Korin naa lohun jeje,
Fun okan t’o nwa anu,
Ko orin isegun na,
Pe Jesu ngba ni la.

C:
Give the winds a mighty voice,
Jesus saves, Jesus saves
Let the nations now rejoice,
Jesus saves, Jesus saves,
Shout salvation full and free,
Highest hills and deepest caves,
This our song of victory,
Jesus saves, Jesus saves.
D:
Ki gbogbo wa korin na,
Pe Jesu ngba ni la,
Ki gbogb’ aiye bu s’ayo,
Pe Jesu ngba ni la,
Ofe ni igbala na,
Igbala kikun si ni,
Orin isegun l’eyi
Pe Jesu ngba ni la.

C:
Our Lord is now rejected
And by the World disowned;
By the many still neglected,
And by the few enthroned;
But soon He’ll come in glory!
The hour is drawing nigh,
For the crowning day is coming
By and by.

Chorus: 
Oh, the crowning day is coming!
Is coming by and by,
When our Lord shall come in “power”
And “glory” from on high!
Oh the glorious sight will gladden
Each waiting, watchful eye,
In the crowning day that’s coming
By and by.
D:
Oluwa ti aiye ko
Lati se li Oba,
Ti nwon tuto si l’oju,
Ti won fi s’ eleya,
Laipe O mbo nin’ ogo;
Ojo na sunmole,
Ojo ti a o de ayanfe li ade.

Chorus:
Ojo ti a o de ade,
Ojo n ambo laipe, 
Gbati Oluwa y’o de,
Ninu agbara Re nla,
A! ojo ologo na,
Y’o ti dun to lati ri
Ojo ti a o de ade lodo Re.

C:
The heav’ns shall glow with splendour
But brighter far than they
The saints shall shine in glory,
As Christ shall them array;
The beauty of the saviour
Shall dazzle ev’ry eye
In the crowning day that’s coming
By and by
[Chorus]
D:
Y’o yo li awosanma,
Ninu ogo Re nla,
Pelu awon ayanfe,
T’a wo l’aso funfun,
Ewa ti Olugbala
Y’o ta gbogbo won yo,
L’ojo ti a o de ayanfe li ade.y
[Chorus]

C:
Our pain shall then be o-ver,
We’ll sing and sigh no more;
Be-hind us all of sor-row,
And naught but joy before
A joy in our Redeemer’
As we to Him are nigh,
In the crowning day that’s coming
By and byy
[Chorus]
D:
Ojo ekun y’o d’opin
‘Banuje wa y’o tan,
Ao f’aiye esu sile,
A  o bo s’imole nla,
Ao yo ayo ‘rapada
T’awa Tire nikan,
L’ojo ti ao de ayanfe li ade.y
[Chorus]

C:
Let all that look for hasten
The coming joyful day
By earnest consecration,
To walk the narrow way;
By gath’ring in the lost ones
For whom our Lord did die,
For the crowning day that’s coming
By and by.y
[Chorus]
D:
Ki gbogb’awon ti nreti
Ojo ologo yi,
Ya ara won si mimo
Ninu ona toro;
Ki nwon maa wa asako
Ti Oluwa ku fun,
‘Tori ojo dide ade sunmole.y
[Chorus]

C:
From Greenland’s icy mountains,
From India’s coral strand,
Where Africa’s sunny fountains
Roll down their golden sand
From many an ancient river,
From many a palmy plain,
They call us to deliver
Their land from error’s chain
D:
Lati ile Hausa,
Lat’ilu Dahomi,
Ni ilea won Tapa
Ati Beriberi,
Lat’ ibiti a ko mo,
Ti a koi ti gbo ri,
Nwon npe wa lati wa so
Ti ihinrere yi.

C:
What though the spicy breezes
Blow soft o’er Ceylon’s Isle,
Though ev’ry prospect pleases,
And only man is vile;
In vain with lavish kindness
The gifts of God are strown,
The heathen in his blindness,
Bows down to wood and stone.
D:
Oluwa nf’ife Re han,
Ninu oorun tin ran,
Ohun gbogbo lo dara,
Enia l’o buru,
Lasan li Oluwa wa
Ntu ibukun Re ka,
Keferi, n’ifoju won,
Nwole bo okuta.

C:
Can we, whose souls are lighted
With wisdom from on high,
Can we to men benighted
The lamp of life deny?
Salvation! Oh, salvation!
The joyful sound proclaim,
Till each remotest nation
Has learnt Messiah’s name.
D:
Nje awa ti a reran,
Nipa ‘mole orun,
Ko to ka f’imole na
Pamo fun elemi;
Igbala! A! Igbala!
Je k’a fun ipe na,
Titi gbogbo orile,
Y’o mo Jesu l’Oba.

C:
Waft, waft, ye winds, His story,
And you, ye waters, roll,
Till, like a sea of glory
It spreads from pole to pole,
Till o’er our ransomed nature
The lamp for sinners slain,
Redeemer, King, Creator,
In bliss returns to reign.
D:
Efufu, mu ‘hin re lo,
Ati enyin odo,
Titi ‘mole ogo Re;
Y’o tan yi aiye ka;
Tit’Odagutan t’a pa,
Fun irapada wa,
Yio pada wa joba,
L’alafia lailai.

Ijoye kan to Jesu wa li ale,
Lati bere ona ‘gbala on ‘mole;
Olukoni dahun l’oro ooto pe,
A o le s’ aitun nyin bi.

Chorus:
A o le s’aitun nyin bi (2)
Otito li oro na ti mo so pe,
A o le s’aitun nyin bi.

C:
Ye children of men, attend to the word
So solemnly uttered by Jesus the Lord,
And let not this message to you be in vain,
“Ye must be born again”.
[Chorus]
D:
Enyin omo enia, e gbo oro
Ti Jesu Oluwa so pelu edun;
Mase je k’oro nab o sasan fun nyin,
A o le s’aitun nyin bi.
[Chorus]

C:
Oh, ye who would enter that glorious rest,
And sing with the ransomed the song of the blest;
The life everlasting if ye would obtain,
“Ye must be born again”
[Chorus]
D:
Enyin t’e nfe de ‘bi ‘simi ogo yi,
Lati baa won mimo korin ‘bukun,
Bi e ba fe gba iye ainipekun.
A o le s’aitun nyin bi.
[Chorus]

C:
A dear one in heaven thy heart yearns to see,
At the beautiful gate may be watching for thee;
Then list to the note of this solemn refrain,
“Ye must be born again”
[Chorus]
D:
Olufe t’okan re nsaferi jojo,
Le ma w’ona re ni bode orun:
Nje fetisi ohun jeje yi,
A o le s’aitun nyin bi
A o le s’aitun nyin bi etc.

C:
O word, of words the sweetest,
O word, in which there lie
All promise, all fulfillment,
And end of mystery!
Lamenting, or rejoicing,
With doubt or terror nigh,
I hear the “Come!” of Jesus,
And to His cross I fly.

Chorus:
“Come! Oh come to Me!
Come! Oh come to Me!
Weary, heavy-laden.
Come! Oh, come to Me!”.
D:
‘Wo oro t’ o dun julo,
T’ o kun fun ileri,
Ati imuse pelu,
Opin ohun ‘jinle,
Nigba ekun at’ayo,
‘Yemeji at’eru,
Mo gbo Jesu wipe, wa,
Mo si lo sodo Re;

Chorus:
Wa, wa sodo Mi
Wa, wa sodo Mi
Alaare t’orun nwo,
Wa, wa, sodo Mi.

C:
O soul! Why shouldst thou wander
From such a loving Friend?
Cling closer, closer to Him,
Stay with Him to the end;
Alas! I am so helpless,
So very full of sin,
For I am ever wandering,
And coming back again
[Chorus]

Oh, each time draw me nearer,
That soon the “come” may be
Naught but a gentle whisper,
To one close, close to Thee,
Then, over sea and mountain,
Far from or near my home,
I’ll take Thy hand and follow,
At that sweet whisper, “come!
[Chorus]
D:
Maa mu mi sunmo ‘do Re,
Ki “Wa” na ba le je
Ohun ti a fo jeje
F’eniti o sunmo O;
Mo mbe l’oke tab’ odo,
Lokere, nitosi,
Emi o ma tele O,
‘Gba mo ba gbo ‘pe, Wa,
    Wa, wa sodo Mi, & c.

C:
O how blest the hour, Lord Jesus
When we can to Thee draw near,
Promises so sweet and precious
From Thy gracious lips to hear.
D:
“Bukun wakati na ti to,
Jesu, ‘gbat’ a sunmo O;
Lati gbo oro iyebiye !
Ti nti enu Re jade !

C:
Be with us this day to bless us,
That we may not hear in vain;
With the saving truths impress us
Which the words of life contain.
D:
Pelu wa loni, bukun wa,
K’a ma j’ olugbo lasan;
Te ooto Re mo wa laiye,
Ti mbo n’nu oro iye.

C:
Open Thou minds, and lead us
Safely on our heavenward way;
With the lamp of truth precede us,
That we may not go astray
D:
Wo wa b’a ti nwa igbala,
Ti a joko l’ese Re;
A nreti ni iparoro,
Lati gb’ohun didun Re.

La wa n’iye, k’O si to wa,
L’alafia l’ona orun;
F’atupa, ooto saju wa,
Ki a ma ba sina lo.

C:
Lord endure Thy word from heaven
With such light, and love, and power,
That in us its silent leaven
May work on from hour to hour.

Give us grace to bear our witness
To the truth’s we have embraced;
And let others both their sweetness
And their quickening virtue taste.
D:
F’imole, ife, agbara,
Fun oro Re lat’ oke;
K’o maa sise b’iwukara,
Ni inu wa titi lo.

C:
See us eager for salvation
Sit, great Master, at thy feet,
And with breathless expectation
Hang upon thine accents sweet.
D:
Ran wa lowo k’a le jeri
Si otito t’a dimu;
K’a si je k’awon elomi
To adun ooto na wo.

C:
O for a faith that will not shrink
Beneath the chastening rod
That will lean upon its own God
Declares” we will conquer”
D:
Igbagbo to ri ‘leri na,
Ti ko ka ‘soro si,
T’ o nwo Olorun nikansoso,
T’o nwipe, “Ao segun”.

C:
A faith shows more bright and clear
In darkness feels no doubt
For God has given me promise
His word shall never fall.
D:
A! eyi koja oye mi,
Sugbon nki y’o beru;
Tor’ Oluwa ti se ‘leri,
Oro Re ki tase.

C:
Lord give us such a faith as this,
That faith that never fails
The faith like ever fix’ed mark
Bends not till its victory.
D:
Igbagbo nla ti ki tase
Baba, joo fifun mi,
Igbagbo t’o nduro gangan,
Titi y’o fi segun.

C:
I always go to Jesus,
When troubled or distressed
I always find a refuge
Upon His loving breast
I tell Him all my trials
I tell Him all my grief
And while my lips are speaking
He gives my heart relief.
D:
‘Gbati ‘danwo yi mi ka,
Odo Krist’ ni mo nlo,
Ni ookan aiya Re ni
Ibi isadi mi.
Mo s’ okan mi paya fun,
O mo gbogb’ edun mi,
Bi mo tin so nkan wonyi,
O m’ edun mi kuro.

C:
When full of dread forebodlogs,
And flowing o’er with tears 
He calms away my sorrow,
And hushes all my fears,
He comprehends my weakness,
The peril I am in,
And he supplies the armour,
I need to conquer sin.
D:
‘Gbati mo kunn fun eru,
Ti mo nsunkun pere,
O tan ibanuje mi,
O le eru, mi lo.
O r’ ewu to yi mi ka,
Ati ailera mi,
O fun mi l’ohun ija,
Lati segun ese.

C:
I always go to Jesus,
No matter when or where
I seek His gracious presence,
I’m sure to find Him there
I’ve times of joy or sorrow
Whate’er my need may be,
I always go to Jesus,
And Jesus comes to me.
D:
Ngo sa lo s’odo Jesu,
Nibi t’o wu k’o je,
Ngo sa maa wa oju Re,
O daju pen go ri,
‘Banuje ni, tab’ ayo?
Ohun t’o wu k’o je,
Odo Re sa ni ngo lo
On y’o si to mi wa.

C:
By childlike faith in Chorusist the Lord
We have from sin salvation
By fully trusting in His word
We pass from condemnation

Chorus: 
we walk by faith and not by sight
“Tis God’s own way and must be right
We walk by faith and not by sight
We follow Christ the light.
D:
Nipa igbagbo ninu Krist’
Awa bo lowo ese,
Nipa gbigbeke l’oro Re,
Awa bo lowo ebi.

Chorus:
 A nrin nipa ‘gbagbo lairi,
 Eyi l’ona Olorun wa,
 A nrin nipa ‘gbagbo lairi,
 A nto Krist’ Imole.

C:
How simple is the way of life
“Tis only to believe Him.
“T will end your sorrow and your strife
If you will but receive Him.
[Chorus]
D:
Ona iye ti orun to,
K’a gbekele Krist’ nikan;
Aro on ija re y’o pin,
Bi iwo ba je gba A.
    A nrin nipa ‘gbagbo lairi &c.

C:
Thro’ Jesus’ death the debt was paid
Not feeling nor emotion;
On Him our sin and guilt was laid,
O! give Him your devotion.
[Chorus]
D:
Iku Jesu l’o san gbese,
Ki ‘se ara on ‘ronu,
O ti rue bi ese wa,
A! fi okan re fun U.
    A nrin nipa ‘gbagbo lairi &c.

C:
We walk by faith and not by sight
How grand is this revealing
“Tis God’s own way and must be right,
“Tis wrong to trust in feeling. 
[Chorus]
D:
A nrin nipa ‘gbagbo lairi,
Imo yi ti tobi to!
Ona Olorun pa l’eyi,
Ma gbekele ero re.
    A nrin nipa ‘gbagbo lairi &c.

C:
My sins, O the peace giving thought
Are buried beneath the wild wave.
Since God in His Mer-cy has brought,
His wonder--ful power to save.

Chorus: 
“Thou wilt cast all their sins in-to the depth of the sea
“Tis the world of the Lord, and sufficient for me,
Tho the bil-lows may roar and may
Break on the shore
They are lost in depths, and can
Reach me no more,
Of the place where they’re buried only
God holds the key,
In depths, the depth of the sea.
D:
Ero didun ni t’ese mi,
T’a sin s’abe omi okun;
‘Gbati agbara Olorun
Dide fun ‘gbala okan mi.

Chorus:  
Iwo yio ran ese won lo s’ogbun okun,
Ileri Oluwa ni, o si to fun mi,
B’omi okun tile nho pelu binu re
Y’o rele y’o si gbe, ko le de odo mi,
Nitori Olorun nikan l’o kawo igbi
Omi nla ti inu okun.

C:
No more shall they rise to distress,
Or trouble the peace of my soul,
As o’er them in pow-er to bless
God’s waves of forgiveness shall roll.
[Chorus]
D:
Won ki y’o tun gb’ogun ti mi,
Tabi yo okan mi lenu;
‘Tori agbara Olorun
Ni y’o mu idariji wa.
   Iwo yio ran ese won lo s’ogbun okun, &c.

C:
No tempest can bring to the light,
The sins He has buried for aye,
My soul precious is in His sight
And he will protect it al-ways.
[Chorus]
D:
Ko si wahala t’o le mu
Ese mi wa si iranti,
Okan mi s’owon loju Re
Y’o d’abo bo nigbagbogbo.
   Iwo yio ran ese won lo s’ogbun okun, &c.

C:
This salvation, ‘tis salvation,
We sinners all cherish
Because the evil we have done
Has caused our destruction.
D:
Igbala ni, Igbala ni
Awa elese nfe;
Nitori ninu buburu
T’a se l’ awa nsegbe.

C:
Every bit of work that we do.
Reveals to us daily;
That it leads not to salvation
Not works can save our soul.
D:
Ise owo wa ti a nse,
O nwi nigbagbogbo
Pe, igbala ko si nibe;
Ise ko le gba ni.

C:
Where O Lord comes our salvation
Reveal it, reveal it
Whether in heaven or down on earth 
Tell us if Thou knowest.
D:
Nibo ni igbala gbe wa?
Fi han mi, fi han mi;
B’o wa loke, bi isale,
B’o ba mo, wi fun wa.

C:
Jesus is only Redeemer
He is our sovereign Lord,
Salvation lies in His own hands
To give to all sinners.

Come now to Him and do receive
There is pure love in Him
He calls all those who are sinners
O come and take it free.

What a fellowship, what a joy divine,
Leaning on the everlasting arms;
What a blessedness, what a peace is mine,
Leaning on the everlasting arms

Chorus: 
Leaning, Leaning,
Safe and secure from all alarms;
Leaning, Leaning
Leaning, on the everlasting arms.
D:
Idapo didun tin fun ‘ni l’ayo,
Mo ngbekele Jesu Oluwa;
Ifaiyabale at’itelorun,
F’awon to ngbekele Oluwa.

Chorus: 
Mo ngbekele,
Ko s’ewu ‘biti Jesu wa;
Mo ngbekele,
Mo ngbekele Jesu Oluwa.

C:
Oh how sweet to talk in this pilgrim way,
Leaning on the everlasting arms;
Oh, how bright the path grows from day to day,
Leaning on the everlasting arms
[Chorus]
D:
A! b’o ti dun to lati maa nrin lo,
Mo ngbekele Jesu Oluwa;
Ona na nye mi si lojojumo,
Mo ngbekele Jesu Oluwa.
[Chorus]

C:
What have I dread, what have I to fear,
Leaning on the everlasting arms;
I have a blessed peace with my Lord so near,
Leaning on the everlasting arms.
[Chorus]
D:
Ko si ‘beru mo, ko si ‘foiya mo,
Mo ngbekele Jesu Oluwa;
Okan mi bale pe mo ni Jesu,
Mo ngbekele Jesu Oluwa.
[Chorus]

C:
All things are possible to him
That can in Jesus’ name believe
Lord, I no more Thy name blaspheme,
Thy truth I lovingly receive,
I can, I do believe in Thee;
All things are possible to me.
D:
Ohun gbogbo l’o je sise
Fun enit’o gba Jesu gbo,
Oruko Re nko kegan mo,
Otito Re ni mo dimu;
Mo gbagbo pe ohun gbogbo
Ni sise fun mi ninu Kristi!

Ohun to soro ju ni pe
Ki ese parun ninu mi;
Mo mo, ore-ofe njoba,
Gege bi oro Re ti wi,
Iwo le se ohun se ohun gbogbo,
Emi na le s’ohun gbogbo.

C:
There’s not a friend like the lowly Jesus
No, not one! No, not one!
None else could heal our soul’s diseases;
No, not one! No not one!

Chorus: 
Jesus knows all about our struggles,
He will guide till the day is done;
There’s not a friend like the lowly Jesus,
No not one! No not one!
D:
K’o s’ore bi Jesu Onirele;
Ko s’okan! ko s’okan!
Ko s’elomi t’o le w’okan wa san,
Ko s’okan! ko s’okan!

Chorus: 
Jesu mo gbogbo idamu wa,
Y’o toju wa d’opin ojo:
Ko s’ore bi Jesu Onirele,
Ko s’okan! ko s’okan!

C:
No friend like Him is so high and holy,
No, not one! No, not one!
And yet no friend is so meek and lowly,
No not one! No not one!
    Jesus knows all about our struggles etc.
D:
Ko s’ore bi Re to ga ni Mimo,
Ko s’okan! ko s’okan!
Ko s’ore to tutu, t’o ni ‘rele,
Ko s’okan! ko s’okan!
[Chorus]

C:
There’s not an hour that He is not near us,
No, not one, no not one!
No, night so dark but His love can cheer us,
No, not one, no not one!
    Jesus knows all about our struggles etc.
D:
Ko s’akoko ti On ko sunmo wa,
Ko s’okan! ko s’okan!
Ko s’ooru ti ‘fe Re ko tu won n’nu
Ko s’okan! ko s’okan!
[Chorus]

C:
Did ever saint find this friend forsake him?
No, no one! No not one!
Or sinner find that He would not take him?
No, not one! No not one!
    Jesus knows all about our struggles etc.
D:
Enikan ha ti r’Ore yi nko ‘ni?
Ko s’okan! ko s’okan!
Tab’ elese ri ko ni gba on la!
Ko s’okan! ko s’okan!
[Chorus]

C:
Was e’er a gift like the Saviour given
No not one! No not one!
Will He refuse us a home in heaven?
No not one! No, not one!
    Jesus knows all about our struggles etc.
D:
Ebun kan ha wa bi ti Jesu wa?
Ko s’okan! ko s’okan!
Y’o ha ko fun wa k’a n’ile l’orun?
Ko je ko! ko je ko!
[Chorus]

On’ agbelebu ni mo nib a l’o ‘le,

Nko ni de enu ona ogo na
Bi mo na so ona yi nu.

Chorus: 
Ona Agbelebu yi,
Lo lo si ile ogo (tara)
O dun kin mo bi  mo ti nrin lo pe
On nikan l’ona ile.

C:
I must needs to go on in the blood-sprinkled way
The path that that the Saviour trod,
If I ever climb to the heights sublime,
Where the soul is at home with God..
[Chorus]
D:
Mo ni lati rin l’ona t’a f’eje won,

Bi mo ba fe goke lo si orun,
Nibiti okan gbe nsimi.
    Ona Agbelebu yi, &c.

C:
Then I bid fare-well to the way of the world,

[Chorus]
D:
‘Gbana ngo ki aiye pe “Odigbose”

‘Tori Kristi duro l’enu ona,
O si pe mi pe “Wa maa bo”
   Ona Agbelebu yi, &c.

C:
Jesus, Thy boundless love to me
No thought can reach, no tongue declare:

And reign without a rival there:
Thine wholly, Thine alone I am,
Be Thou alone my constant flame.
D:
Jesu, ailopin ife Re,
Ko si b’a ti le rohin Re;
S’okan ope mi ni Tire,
K’O si nikan joba nibe!
Tire ni mi, patapata,
Maa mu ‘fe mi gbona titi.

C:
O love, how cheering is Thy ray;
All pain before Thy presence flies,
Care, anguish, sorrow, melt away,
Where’er Thy healing beams arise:
O Jesus, nothing may I see,
Nothing desire, or seek, but Thee.
D:
Itansan ‘fe fun mi l’ayo!
Irora sa niwaju Re:
Aniyan, ‘banuje, y’o lo,
Nibi ‘tansan ‘wosan re de;
Jesu, jowo ma je kin le
Ohunkohun kan lehin Re.

C:
I need Thee ev’ry hour,
Most gracious Lord
No tender voice like Thine

Chorus:  
I need Thee, Oh, I need Thee,

Oh, bless me now my Saviour,
I come to Thee;
D:
Mo fe O n’gbagbogbo,
Oluwa Oloore,
Ko s’ohun tin fun ni
L’alafia bi Tire;

Chorus:
Mo fe O, A! mo fe O,
Ni wakati gbogbo;
Bukun mi Olugbala,
Mo wa s’odo Re.

C:
I need Thee every hour,
Stay Thou nearby;
Temptations lose their power

[Chorus]
D:
Mo fe O n’gbagbogbo,
Mase jina si mi;
Idanwo ko n’ipa
Gbat’ O wa nitosi.
Mo fe O, etc.

C:
I need Thee every hour,
In joy or pain,

[Chorus]
D:
Mo fe O n’gbagbogbo,
L’ayo tab’ irora;
Yara wa ba mi gbe,
K’aiye mi ma j’asan.
Mo fe O, etc.

C:
I need Thee every hour,
Teach me Thy will;
And Thy rich promises
In me fulfill
[Chorus]
D:
Mo fe O n’gbagbogbo,
Ko mi ni ife Re;
K’O jek Ileri Re
Ko se si mi l’ara,
Mo fe O etc.

C:
I need Thee every hour,
Most Holy One;
Oh, make me Thine indeed,
Thou blessed Son.
[Chorus]

Jesus, my Lord, my God, my All

Chorus: 
Jesus, my Lord, I Thee adore,
Oh make me love Thee more and more
D:
Jesu Oluwa, Oba mi,
Gb’ohun mi nigbati mo npe,
Gb’ohun mi lati ‘bugbe Re.
Rojo Ore-ofe sile.

Chorus: 
Oluwa mi, mo feran Re,

C:
Jesus, too late I Thee have sought

[Chorus]
D:
Jesu, mo ti jafara ju,
Ngo se le fe O b’ o ti ye?
Em’ o se ‘le gb’ogo Re ga,
Ati ewa oruko Re.
[Chorus]

C:
Jesus, what didst Thou find in me,

How great the joy that Thou hast brought

[Chorus]
D:
Jesu, kil’o ri ninu mi,
Ti ‘fe naa fi po to bayi?
Ore Re si mi ti po to!
O ta gbogbo ero mi yo!
[Chorus]

C:
Jesus, of Thee shall be my son ,

And Thou, blest Saviour Thou art mine.
[Chorus]
D:
Jesu, ‘Wo o je orin mi,
Tire l’aiya at’okan mi;
Tire ni gbogbo ini mi,
Olugbala, ‘Wo ni temi.
[Chorus]

C:
Sweet is the promise “I will not forget thee”
Nothing can molest or turn my soul away

Just beyond is shining an eternal day.

Chorus: 
I-will not forget thee or leave thee,
In My hands I’ll hold thee, in My arms I’ll fold thee
I-will not forget thee or leave thee.
I am Thy Redeemer, I will care for thee
D:
Gbo b’O ti wi “Emi ki y’o gbagbe re”.
Ko si ohun t’o le damu okan mi;
Bi mo tile nrin ni afonifoji,
Imole aiyeraiye ko ni pe mo.
 
Chorus:
Emi ki yio gbagbe re lai,
Mo gbe o l’apa, mo f’owo mi di o mu;
Emi ki yio gbagbe re lai,
Emi Olugbala y’o se ‘toju re.

C:
How can I show my gratitude to Jesus
For His love unfailing and His tender care
I will proclaim to others His salvation,
That they may accept Him and His promise share.
[Chorus]
D:
Emi o se fi imoore han fun?
Ife at’itoju Re po lori mi,
Ngo maa rohin igbala Re kakiri,
Ki nwon le ni ipin n’nu ileri Re.
[Chorus]

C:
Trusting the promise “I will not forget thee”
Onward will I go with songs of joy and praise
Though earth despise me though my
Friends forsake me
Jesus will be near me, gladdening my days.
[Chorus]
D:
Ngo romo ileri yi bi mo tin lo,
“Emi ko gbagbe re, nko fi o sile”
Ngo maa tesiwaju, ngo si maa Ko’rin;
Bi aiye nkegan mi, Jesu sunmo mi.
[Chorus]

C:
When at the golden portals I am standing
All my tribulations all my sorrows past,
How sweet to hear the blessed proclamation

At last”.
[Chorus]
D:
‘Gbati mo ba gunle s’ebute ogo,
T’idamu on ‘ponju mi si koja lo,
Y’o ti dun to lati gb’ohun Re didun
“Kabo omo rere, s’inu ayo re”.
[Chorus]

C:
A friend of Jesus, oh, what bliss!
That one so weak as I
Should ever have a friend like this

Chorus: 
Friendship with Jesus,
Fellowship divine;
Oh, what blessed sweet communion,
Jesus is a friend of mine.
D:
Ore Jesu! Iro didun,
F’alailera b’emi;
Pe mo ti yan Jesu l’ore,
Ti y’o mu mi re ‘le.

Chorus:
Temi ti Jesu, 
Ore mi owon,
Idapo ti o dun julo,
Jesu di ore mi lai.

C:
A friend when other friendships cease
A friend when others fail;
A friend who gives me joy and peace,
A friend who will prevail.
[Chorus]
D:
Ore ododo ni Jesu,
Ore miran nkuna;
Ore ti nmu ayo mi kun,
Ore ti o nsegun.
[Chorus]

C:
A friend to lead me in the dark,
A friend who knows the way;
A friend to steer my weak, frail bark
A friend my debts to pay
[Chorus]
D:
Ore tin se Amona mi,
Ti nfi ona han mi;
Ore to mo ailera mi,
Ti nsan Igbese mi.
[Chorus]

C:
A friend when sickness lays me low,
A friend when death draws near,
A friend as through the vale I go,
A friend to help and cheer.
[Chorus]
D:
Ore mi nigba mo s’aisan,
Ati nigba iku;
Ore ti y’o mu mi laa ja,
Ti y’o  ran mi lowo.
[Chorus]

C:
A friend when life’s rough voyage is o’er,

A friend to greet on heaven’s shore
A friend when home at last
[Chorus]
D:
Ore mi lehin aiye yi,
T’iku p’oju mi de,
Ore ti y’o wa pade mi,
Ni ile mi l’oke.
[Chorus]

C:
Once I fought to con-quer sin,
