Till my Saviour came one day;
Then He triumphed o-ver all,
When He heard my pleading call,
And He took my sins away.

Chorus: 
He took my sins away
Took them all away
Chorusist the Saviour took my sins away;
Contentment fills my soul,
His Spirit has control,
Since Jesus took my sins away.
D:
Lekan mo ba ese ja,
‘Gbat’o njoba l’okan mi,
Tit’ Olugbala fi de,
O si segun gbogbo won,
Nigbat’ O gbo  ebe mi;
O si ko ese mi lo.

Chorus: 
O ko ese mi lo,
O ko gbogbo re,
Kristi Jesu ko ese mi lo;
Itelorun ti de.
Emi Re ti bori,
Bi Jesu ti k’ese mi lo.

C:
O, the wonder working pow’r
In that happy, blessed hour
When my Saviour spoke to me;
And I heard the precious word,
From this wonder working Lord,
When, from sin, He set me free.
[Chorus]
D:
Agbara ise ‘yanu
Ni wakati didun na,
Ti Jesu ba mi s’oro,
Mo gbo’ro ‘yebiye na,
Lat’ enu Oluwa mi, 
‘Gbati O da mi ni ‘de.
[Chorus]

C:
Are you struggling for the right,
Jesus has the pow’r and might;
He will help you conquer sin;
He will come with you to stay,
He will take its pow’r away
And will give you peace within.
[Chorus]
D:
Iwo nja fun rere bi?
Jesu ni gbogbo ipa,
Yo segun ese fun o
On y’o gba agbara re;
On y’o si ma ba o gbe.
Yo si fun o ni ‘simi.
[Chorus]

C:
Like a Shepherd, tender, true,
Jesus leads, Jesus leads
Daily finds us pastures new,
Jesus leads, Jesus leads
If thick mists, are o’er the way
Or the flock ‘mid danger feeds
He will watch them lest they stray,
Jesus leads, Jesus leads.
D:
B’Olus’ agutan rere,
Jesu nto wa, Jesu nto wa,
Si papa oko tutu,
Jesu nto wa O nto wa;
Bi ‘kuku ba bo ona,
T’ewu si yi agbo ka,
Ki y’o jeki won sina,
Jesu nto wa, O nto wa.

C:
All along life’s rugged road,
Jesus leads, Jesus leads
Till we reach yon blest abode,
Jesus leads, Jesus leads
All the way before, He’s trod
And He now the flock precedes,
Safe into the folds of God.
Jesus leads, Jesus leads.
D:
Ninu wahala aiye,
Jesu nto wa, Jesu nto wa,
Titi ao fi de oke,
Jesu nto wa, O nto wa,
O ti nrin ona na ri,
O si nko agutan Re;
Lo sinu agbo t’orun,
Jesu nto wa, O nto wa.

C:
Thro’ the sunlit ways of life
Jesus leads, Jesus leads,
Thro’ the warnings and the strife,
Jesus leads, Jesus leads;
When we reach the Jordan’s tide
Where life’s bound’ry line recedes,
He will spread the waves aside,
Jesus leads, Jesus leads.
D:
Ninu ‘mole aiye yi,
Jesu nto wa, Jesu nto wa,
Larin ogun at’ija,
Jesu nto wa, O nto wa,
‘Gbat’ a ba d’odo Jordan,
Nibiti ajo wa pin,
Y’o si pin omi n’iya,
Jesu nto wa, O nto wa.

C:
Hark! On the highway of life a sound,
As created waves of ocean roar;
Lash’d by the storm in its fu-ry spent
As they beat up-on the shore.

Chorus: 
Hear the tramp, tramp, tramp of the Army
As they march along the way of life,
They are weary of the toil and the travel,
Of the bit-terness of strife:
But they hope and trust, looking ev-er
On the path the saints before have trod,
And as much a-long their faith grows
Strong in the Church of the liv-ing God.
D:
Gbo iro li opopo aiye,
Bi ti igbi omi okun,
Ti nfi agbara re ru soke
T’ o si nkolu ebute.

Chorus: 
Gbo iro omo oogun
Bi nwon ti nrin lo li onna na,
Are mu won fun ‘se at’irin ajo,
Ati ija kikoro;
Sugbon nwon gbagbo-nwon tejumo;
Ona na t’awon momi ti nrin,
Bi nwon tin lo ni gbagbo won,
Ndagba n’nu Olorun alaye.

C:
Onward they march with a faith unmoved
By any-change of time or creed
Their’s to believe that the word of God
Can sup-ply the world’s great need.
[Chorus]
D:
Nwon ntesiwaju pelu ‘gbagbo,
Ti eko keko ko le mi,
Nwon gbagbo pe oro Olorun,
Le pese f’aini gbogbo.
[Chorus]

C:
Step in the ranks you are need-ed there,
Cling to the Church and God will bless
He is the hope of the whole wide world
For the cause of righteousness. 
[Chorus]
D:
Dapo mo won, aye wa sibe,
Duro de ‘bukun Olorun;
On ni ‘reti gbogbo agbaiye,
Lati sise ododo.
[Chorus]

C:
Brightly gleams our banner, pointing to the sky
Waving on Chorusist’s soldiers to their home on high!
Marching through the desert, gladly thus we pray,
Still with hearts united, singing on our way.

Chorus: 
Brightly gleams our banner, 
Pointing to the sky,
Waving on Chorusist’s soldiers to their
Home on high.
D:
Didan l’opagun wa, o ntoka s’orun,
O nfona han ogun, si ile wo orun;
Lar’n aginju l’a nrin, l’ayo l’a ngbadura
Pel’okan isokan l’a m’ on orun pon.

Chorus: 
Didan l’opagun wa, 
O ntoka s’orun,
O nf’ona han ogun, 
s’ile won orun.

C:
Jesus, Lord and Master, at Thy sacred feet,
Here with hearts rejoicing, see Thy children meet,
Often have we left Thee, often gone astray;
Keep us, mighty Saviour, in the narrow way.
[Chorus]
D:
Jesu Oluwa wa, l’ese Re owo,
Pelu okan ayo l’omo Re pade;
A ti fi O sile A si ti sako,
To wa Olugbala si ona toro.
    Didan l’opagun wa &c.

C:
Pattern of our childhood, once Thyself a child,
Make our childhood holy, pure and meek, and mild,
In the hour of danger whither can we flee,
Save to Thee, dear Saviour, only unto Thee?
[Chorus]

Then with saints and angels may we join above,
Offering prayers and praises at Thy
Throne of love;
When the march is over, then comes rest
and peace,
Jesus in His beauty, songs that never
cease.
[Chorus]
D:
K’a le pelu awon Angeli l’oke,
Lati jumo mma yin n’ite ife Re,
‘Gbat’ ajo wa ba pin, isinmi y’o de,
At’ Alafia, at’ orin ailopin.
    Didan l’opagun wa, &c.

C:
Marching on in the light of God,
Marching on, I’m marching on:
Up the path that the Master trod,
Marching, marching on.

Chorus: 
A robe of white, a crown of gold,
A harp, a home, a mansion fair,
A victor’s palm, a joy untold,
Are mine when I get there
For Jesus is my Saviour, He’s washed my sins away,
Paid my debt on Calv’ry’s mountain,
Happy in His dying love, singing all the day.
I’m living, yes, I’m living in the Fountain.
D:
Ninu imole Olorun,
Je k’a ma tesiwaju;
Ona ti Oluwa war in,
Maa tesiwaju.

Chorus: 
Aso funfun, ade wura,
Duru ati ile wura,
Ayo at’imo isegun,
Ti emi ni l’oke;
Jesu li Oluwa mi,
O we ese mi nu,
O san gbogbo igbese mi,
Mo nyo ninu ife re;
Mo nkorin didun,
Mo ngbe nibi orisun omi iye.

C:
Marching on through the hosts of sin,
Marching on, I’m marching on:
Victory’s mine while I’ve Christ within,
Marching, marching on.
[Chorus]
D:
B’ese tile ngbogun ti wa,
Je ka ma tesiwaju,
Mo ni Krist’ temi n’isegun,
 Maa tesiwaju.
[Chorus]

C:
Marching on while the world lings sneer,
Marching on, I’m matching on:
Perfect love casteth out all fear,
Marching, marching on.
[Chorus]
D:
Bi aiye tile nkegan wa,
Je k’a ma tesiwaju;
Ife pipe nle eru lo.
 Maa tesiwaju.
[Chorus]

C:
Marching on it the Spirit’s might,
Marching on, I’m marching on;
More than conqueror in every fight,
Marching, marching on.
[Chorus]
D:
Ninu agbara Emi Re,
Je k’a ma tesiwaju;
Awa y’o ju asegun lo,
 Maa tesiwaju.
[Chorus]

C:
Marching on to the realms above,
Marching on, I’m marching on:
There to sing of redeeming love,
Marching, marching on.
[Chorus]
D:
A nlo si ile wa l’oke,
Je k’a ma tesiwaju,
Nibe ao korin ‘rapada,
 Maa tesiwaju.
[Chorus]

C:
I’m not ashamed to own my Lord,
Or to defend His cause;
Maintain the honour of His word,
The glory of His cross.

Chorus: 
At the cross, where I first
Saw the light,
And the burden of my heart rolled away,
It was there by faith I received my sight,
And now I am happy all the day.
D:
Oju Oluwa ko ti mi,
Nko tiju ise Re;
Lati gb’ola oro Re ga,
At’ agbelebu Re.

Chorus:
Nibi agbelebu ni mo ko r’imole,
Nibe, eru okan mi si fo lo;
Nibe nipa igbagbo mo riran,
Nisi, mo wa l’alafia titi.

C:
Jesus, my Lord! I know His name
His name is all my trust,
Nor will He put my soul to shame,
Nor let my hope be lost.
[Chorus]
D:
Mo  m’oruko Oluwa mi,
On ni mo gbekele;
Ko ni je ki oju ti mi,
Ko nsi so ‘reti nu.
[Chorus]

C:
Firm as His throne, His promise stands,
And He can well secure
What I’ve committed to His hands
Till the decisive hour.
[Chorus]
D:
Ileri Re duro sinsin,
Y’o pa ohun na mo;
Ti mo fi si itoju Re,
Titi d’ojo ‘kehin.
[Chorus]

C:
Then will He own my worthless name
Before His Father’s face;
And in the New Jerusalem,
Appoint my soul a place.
[Chorus]
D:
‘Gbana y’o gba mi  sodo Re
Bi mo tile s’aiye;
Nilu Jerusalem titun,
Y’o fi mi s’ipo mi.
[Chorus]

C:
My faith has found a resting place,
Not in device nor creed;
I trust the Ever-living One,
His wounds for me shall plead.

Chorus: 
I need no other argument,
I need no other plea,
It is enough that Jesus died,
And that He died for me.
D:
Igbagbo mi ri bi ‘simi,
Ibi ‘simi didun
Jesu ni mo gbeke mi le,
A saa l’ogbe fun mi.

Chorus:
Nko ni s’aroye miran mo,
Nko ni wa awawi kan,
Pe Jesu ku fun ese mi,
Eyi ti to fun mi.

C:
Enough for me that Jesus saves,
This ends my fear and doubt,
A sinful soul I come to Him,
He’ll never cast me out.
[Chorus]
D:
O to fun mi pe Jesu ku,
Ero ko ba mi mo,
Pel’eru ese ni mo wa,
Ko si je ta mi ni.
[Chorus]

C:
My heart is leaning on the word,
The written word of God,
Salvation by my Saviour’s name
Salvation through His blood.
[Chorus]
D:
Okan mi simi l’oro Re,
Oro t’a ko sile;
Ooko Re la fi ngba wa la,
At’eje Re pelu.
[Chorus]

C:
My great Physician heals the sick,
The lost He came to save:
For me his precious blood He shed,
For me His life He gave.
D:
Jesu Oluwosan ara,
Oluwosan emi,
O f’emi Re lele  fun mi,
O t’eje Re sile.

C:
Redeemed, how I love to proclaim it,
Redeemed by the blood of the Lamb
Redeemed through His infinite mercy,
His child and forever I am.

Chorus: 
Redeemed……Redeemed……
Redeemed by the blood of the Lamb,
Redeemed……..Redeemed…..
His child and forever I am.
D:
Mo ti di eni-irapada,
Nipa eje Odaguntan,
Anu Re l’o fir a mi pada;
Mo d’om’Olorun titi lai.

Chorus:
Irapada, eje Re l’o ra mi pada,
Irapada, Mo d’om’Olorun titi lai.

C:
Redeemed and so happy in Jesus,
No language my rapture can tell;
I know that the light of His presence
With me doth continually dwell.
[Chorus]
D:
Mo ti di eni irapada,
Ayo mi enu ko le so,
Imole oju Re ntan si mi,
Y’o ma ba mi gbe titi lai.
[Chorus]

C:
I think of my blessed Redeemer,
I think of Him all the day long;
I sing, for I cannot be silent,
His love is the theme of my song.
[Chorus]
D:
Mo nronu Olurapada mi, 
Mo nronu Re t’osan t’oru,
Mo nko’rin iyin si laidekun,
Orin ti ife Re si mi.
[Chorus]

C:
I know I shall see in His beauty,
The King in whose law I delight;
Who lovingly guarded my footsteps,
And giveth me songs in the night.
[Chorus]
D:
Lojo kan ngo rii nin’ewa Re,
Oba ti inu mi ndun si,
Enit’ O nto isise mi lo,
Ati orin mi li oru.
[Chorus]

C:
I know there’s a crown that is waiting
In yonder bright mansion for me;
And soon with the spirits made perfect,
At home with the Lord I shall be.
[Chorus]
D:
Ade kan nduro de mi l’ohun,
Nibit’ O lo pese aye;
Pel’awon ti a so di pipe
Ao maa ba gbe titi aiye.
[Chorus]

C:
I know not why God’s wondrous grace
To me He hath made known,
Nor why, unworthy, Chorusist in love
Redeemed me for His own

Chorus: 
But I know whom I have believed
And am persuaded that He is able 
To keep that which I’ve committed
Unto Him against that day.
D:
Ko ye mi b’ore-ofe Re
Ti wa mi l’awari,
B’O ti f’eje Re ‘yebiye
Ra abosi b’emi.

Chorus:
Sugbon mo m’eniti mo gbagbo,
O da mi loju pe O le pa mo
Ohun ti mo fi le E lowo,
Titi di ojo ‘kehin.

C:
I know not how this saving faith
To me He did impart,
Nor how believing in His word
Wrought peace within my heart
[Chorus]
D:
Ko ye mi bi mo se d’eni
T’o ni ‘gbagbo aye,
B’Oro Re tin fun okan mi
Ni isimi didun.
[Chorus]

C:
I know not how the Spirit moves,
Convincing men of sin,
Revealing Jesus through the Word,
Creating faith in Him.
[Chorus]
D:
Ko ye mi b’ Emi ti nsise,
T’o nfi ese han mi,
T’o nfi ewa Jesu han wa,
T’o mbusi ‘gbagbo wa.
[Chorus]

C:
I know not what of good or ill
May be reserved for me,
Of weary ways of golden days
Before His face I see.
[Chorus]
D:
Nko mo ‘hun t’o le de, 
Ibi tabi rere,
Ayo tabi ibanuje,
Ki nto r’Oluwa mi.
[Chorus]

C:
I know not when my Lord may come,
At night or noonday fair,
Nor if, I’ll walk the vale with Him,
Or “meet Him in the air”.
[Chorus]
D:
Nko mo ‘gbat’ Oluwa y’o de,
L’ooro tabi l’ale;
Beni nko m’akoko iku,
Ti a o se mi logo.  
[Chorus]

C:
I’m pressing on the upward way,
New heights I’m gaining every day;
Still praying as I onward bound,
“Lord, plant my feet on higher ground.

Chorus: 
Lord lift me up and let me stand
By faith, on heaven’s table-land
Where love, and joy, an light abound,
Lord, plat my feet on higher ground.

My heart has no desire to stay
Where doubts arise, and fears dismay;
Though some may dwell where these abound,
My constant aim is higher ground.
[Chorus]
D:
Ife okan mi ko duro,
Larin ‘yemeji at’eru,
Awon miran le ma gbe be
Ibi giga l’okan mi nfe.
[Chorus]

C:
Beyond the mist I fain would rise,
To rest beneath unclouded skies
Above earth’s turmoil peace is found
By those who dwell on higher ground.
[Chorus]
D:
Mo fe ki nga ju aiye lo,
B’esu tile ngbogun ti mi,
Mo nfi ‘gbagbgo gbo orin na,
Ti awon mimo nko loke.
[Chorus]

C:
I long to scale the utmost height,
Though rough the way, and hard the fight,
My song, while climbing, shall resound,
Lord, lead me on to higher ground.
[Chorus]
D:
Mo fe de’bi giga julo,
Ninu ogo didan julo,
Mo ngbadura kin le de ‘be,
Oluwa, mu mi de ‘le na.
[Chorus]

C:
Lord, lead me up the mountain side,
I dare not climb without my Guide;
And, heaven gained, I’ll gaze around,
With grateful heart from higher ground.
[Chorus]
D:
Fa mi lo si ibi giga,
Laisi Re nko ni le de ‘be;
Fa mi titi d’oke orun,
Ki nko’rin lat’ibi giga.
[Chorus]

C:
More about Jesus would I know,
More of His grace to others show;
More of His saving fullness see,
More of His love who died for me.

Chorus:
More, more about Jesus,
More, more about Jesus
More of His saving fullness see,
More of His love who died for me.
D:
Ki nle tubo mo Jesu si,
Ki ngba ekun or’ofe Re;
Ki nmo igbala Re kikun,
Ki nmo adun ife Re si.

Chorus:
Ki nle mo Jesu si,
Ki nle mo Jesu si,
Ki nmo igbala Re kikun,
Ki nmo adun ife Re si.

C:
More about Jesus let me learn,
More of His holy will discern;
Spirit of God my Teacher be,
Showing the things of Christ to me.
[Chorus]
D:
Ki nle tubo mo Jesu si,
Ki nk’eko rere lara re;
Emi Orun jowo ko mi,
Fi iwa ti Jesu wo mi.
[Chorus]

C:
More about Jesus in His word,
Holding communion with my Lord;
Hearing His voice in every line,
Making each faithful saying mine.
[Chorus]
D:
Ki nle tubo mo Jesu si,
Ki temi Tire n’idapo;
Ninu Bibeli kin le mo
Ojulowo ife Baba.
[Chorus]

Ki nle tubo mo Jesu si,
Ki nmo opo isura Re;
Ki ntan ijoba Re kale,
Ki nkede ipadabo Re.
[Chorus]

C:
Are you trusting Jesus, All along the way?
Does He grow more precious To your heart each day?
Are you His disciple?
Test His word and see,
He will give the Spirit
More abundantly

Chorus: 
More…. Abundantly, more……abundantly
“That they might have life and more
Abundantly. 2ce
D:
Iwo ha ngbekele Jesu b’o ti nlo?
O ha sowon ju ti atihinwa lo?
O ha j’om’ehin Re, ye Oro Re wo?
Y’o fun o l’Emi Re si lopolopo.

Chorus:
 Ki nwon le n’iye, li opolopo,
 Ki nwon le n’iye iye l’opolopo;
 Ki nwon le n’iye lo opolopo,
 Ki nwon le ni iye li opolopo.

C:
For His matchless favour Magnify the name
Of our gracious Saviour Who from glory came,
Let the saints adore Him For this wondrous Word,
Sealing our redemption Through the crimson flood.
D:
Fun inu-rere Re gbe Ooko Re ga,
Olugbala wa t’o n t’orun sokale,
K’awon ayanfe Re juba Oro Re.
Eni ra wa pada nipa eje Re

Wa pelu igbagbo, wa je ipe Re,
Gbogb’ ohun ‘e ti gba, wa jowo re fun,
Y’o tewogb’ enit’o saw a sodo Re,
Y’o da ibukun Re lu lopolopo.

C:
Once far from God and dead in sin
No light my heart could see;
But in God’s Word the light I found,
Now Christ liveth in me

Chorus:
Christ liveth in me,….
Christ liveth in me,….
Oh, what a salvation this,
That Christ liveth in me.
D:
Lekan mo jonna s’Olorun,
Mo ku ninu ese;
Oro Re fun mi n’imole,
Krisiti ngbe ninu mi.

Chorus:
Kristi ngbe n’nu mi,
Kristi ngbe n’nu mi,
Igbala nla l’eyi je;
Pe Kristi ngbe n’nu mi.

C:
As rays of light from yonder sun
The flowers of earth set free,
So life and light and love came forth
From Christ living in me.
[Chorus]
D:
B’itansan imole oorun,
Ti nmu itanna tan,
Beni ‘mole iye nwole,
Bi Krist’ ti ngbe n’nu mi.
[Chorus]

C:
As lives the flower within the seed,
As in the cone the tree,
So, praise the God of truth and grace
His spirit dwelleth in me.
[Chorus]
D:
Bi eka l’ara ajara,
Beni mo je loni,
Nipa Oro ore-ofe,
Emi Re ngbe n’nu mi.
[Chorus]

C:
With longing all my heart is filled,
That like Him I may be,
As on the wondrous thought I dwell,
That Christ liveth in me.
[Chorus]
D:
Ongbe Re l’o ngbe okan mi,
Ki nsa le dabi Re;
Iro yi l’o nmu ‘nu mi dun,
Pe Kristi ngbe n’nu mi. 
[Chorus]

C:
Deeper in the love of Jesus
Daily let me go;
Higher, higher in the school of wisdom,
More of grace to know.

Chorus:
O deeper yet I pray,
And higher every day;
And wiser, blessed Lord.
In Thy precious, holy word.
D:
Ki nle jinle ninu ife Jesu,
Li ojojumo;
Ki ngoke giga ninu imo Re.
At’or’ofe Re.

Chorus:
Mu mi jinle pupo,
Gbe mi soke giga;
Fun mi ni ogbon si
Ninu Oro Mimo Re.

C:
Deeper, deeper! Blessed Holy Spirit,
Take me deeper still,
Till my life is wholly lost in Jesus.
And His perfect will.
[Chorus]
D:
Ki nle jinle ninu Emi Mimo,
Mu mi jinle si;
Ki gbogb’ aiye mi le je ti Jesu,
Ati ife Re.
[Chorus]

C:
Deeper, deeper, though it cost hard trial,
Deeper let me go!
Rooted in the holy love of Jesus,
Let me fruitful grow.
[Chorus]
D:
Ki nle jinleb’idanwo tile de,
Mu mi jinle si;
Ki nfi gbongbo mule, ninu Jesu,
Ki nle s’eso si.
[Chorus]

C:
Deeper, higher every day in Jesus,
Till all conflict past,
Finds me conqu’ror, and His own image
Perfected at last.
[Chorus]
D:
Gbe mi soke ni igba idanwo,
Joo, mu mi l’aaja;
Si se mi ni asegun bi Tire,
Titi de opin.
[Chorus]

C:
Once my eyes were blind to the beau-ty of the Lord,
Once my ears were closed to the pleadings of His word;
Once these hands of mine pressed the thorn-crown on His brow,
but all this He has for-given and it’s all right now.

Chorus: 
Yes, it’s all right now yes, It’s all right now.
He has heard my pray’r and It’s all right now yes,
Yes it’s all right now yes, It’s all right now,
All my sins are covered and It’s all right now.

Once I loved the world with its glitters and its show
I was cap-tive held with the pleasures here below;
But one day He came, tho I can no tell you how,
With His blood my sins He covered, and its all right now.
[Chorus]
D:
Lekan ri mo fe aiye ati ogo re,
Adun aiye yi ti de mi ni igbekun;
Sugbon On de n’jokan l’ona ti nko le so,
O f’eje Re bo ese mi, ko tun si nkan mo.
[Chorus]

C:
O it is so prec-cious to be alone with Him,
When the shadow fall and my eyes with tears are dim;
Just to feel His hand rest in love upon my brow,
And to hear Him gent-ly whisper, It is all right now.
[Chorus]

O for a heart to praise my God,
A heart from sin set free,
A heart that always feels Thy Blood
So freely split for me.
D:
Mo fe okan laini ese,
Lati yin Oluwa;
Okan ti o mo eje Re,
T’a ta sile l’ofe.

C:
A heart resigned, submissive, meek,
My great Redeemer’s throne,
Where only Christ is heard to speak,
Where Jesus reigns alone:
D:
Okan suru, t’o si tutu,
Ite Oludande,
Nibi Kristi nikan nsoro,
Ti o nikan njoba.

C:
A humble, lowly contrite heart,
Believing, true, and clean;
Which neither life nor death can part
From Him that dwells within.
D:
Okan ‘rele ti nsa f’ese,
T’ o gbagbo, t’o si mo;
T’ iku tab’ iye ko le ya,
Lodo Krist’ ti ngbe ‘be.

C:
A heart in every thought renewed,
And full of love divine;
Perfect, and right, and pure, and good.
A copy, Lord, of Thine.
D:
Okan titun patapata,
T’ o kun fun ‘fe orun;
Pipe, tito, mimo, rere,
Aworan Re, Jesu!

C:
Thy nature, gracious Lord, impart
Come quickly from above,
Write Thy name upon my heart,
Thy name, best name of love.
D:
Oluwa, f’ iwa Re fun mi,
Joo sokale Kankan;
Ko ooko titun s’ aiya mi,
Oruko Re t’ ife.

C:
Jesus, I my cross have taken
All to leave and follow Thee;
Destitute, despised, forsaken,
Thou from hence my all shall be:
Perish every fond ambition,
All I’ve sought, or hoped, or known;
Yet how rich is my condition!
God and heaven are still my own.
D:
Jesu, mo gb’agbelebu mi,
Ki nle ma to O lehin;
Otosi at’ eni egan
‘Wo l’ohun gbogbo fun mi:
Bi ini mi gbogbo segbe,
Ti ero mi gbogbo pin;
Sibe oloro ni mo je!
Temi ni Krist’ at’Orun.

C:
Man may trouble and distress me,
‘Twill but drive me to Thy breast;
Life with trials hard may press me,
Heaven will bring me sweeter rest.
Oh, ‘tis not in grief to harm me,
While Thy love is left to me;
Oh, ‘t were not in joy to charm me,
Were that joy unmix’d with Thee.
D:
Eda le ma wahala mi,
Yo’ mu mi sunmo O ni;
Idanwo aiye le ba mi,
Orun o mu ‘simi wa,
Ibanuje ko le se nkan,
B’ife Re ba wa fun mi;
Ayo ko si le dun mo mi,
B’Iwo ko si ninu re.

C:
Hast ethen on from grace to glory,
Arm’d bv faith and wing’d by prayer.
Heaven’s eternal day’s before thee,
God’s own hand shall guide thee there,
Soon shall close thy earthly mission,
Swift shall pass thy pilgrim days,
Hope soon change to glad fruition,
Faith to sight, and prayer to praise.
D:
Nje koja lat’ ore s’ogo,
N’n’adura on igbagbo;
Ojo ailopin wa fun O,
Baba y’o muo de ‘be;
Ise re laiye fere pin,
Ojo aajo re mbuse,
Ireti y’o pada s’ayo,
Adura s’orin iyin.

C:
Thou art the way ,-to Thee alone
From sin and death we flee;
And he, who would the Father seek,
Must seek Him, Lord by Thee.
D:
Iwo l’Ona; odo Re ni
Awa o ma sa bo;
Awon t’o nsaferi Baba,
Yio wa s’odo Re.

C:
Thou art the truth, - Thy word alone.
True wisdom can impart;
Thou only canst inform the mind,
And purify the heart.

Thou art the life,- the rending tomb
Proclaims Thy conquering aim;
And those who put their trust in Thee,
Nor death no hell shall harm.
D:
Iwo n’Iye: iboji Re;
Fi agbara Re han,
Awon t’o gbekewon le O,
Nwon bo lowo iku.

C:
Thou art the way, the truth, the life;
Grant us that way to know,
That truth to keep, that life to win
Whose joys eternal flow.
D:
Iwo l’Ona, Ooto, Iye
Je k’a mo ona Re;
K’a mo otito at’iye,
T’ayo re ko l’opin.

C:
My stubborn  will at last hath yielded;
I would be Thine and Thine alone;
And this the prayer my lips are bringing,
Lord, let in me Thy will be done.

Chorus:
Sweet will of God, still fold me closer,
Till I am wholly lost in Thee:
Sweet will of God, still fold me closer,
Till I am wholly lost in Thee.
D:
Mo jowo ara mi f’ Oluwa,
Ngo je Tire, Tire nikan;
Eyi ni y’o je adura mi,
Mu ife Re se ninu mi.

Chorus:
Fa mi mora, f’ife Re fa mi,
Ki nsonu s’inu ife Re;
Fa mi mora, f’ife Re fa mi,
Ki nsonu sinu ife Re.

C:
I’m tired of sin, footsore and weary,
The darksome path hath dreary grown,
But now a light has ris’n to cheer me!
I find in Thee my Star, my Sun.
[Chorus]
D:
Lo,
Ese ti ba aiye mi je
Sugbon Iwo ti tan imole,
Iwo l’orun ododo mi.

C:
Thy precious will, o conqu’ring Saviour
Doth now embrace and compass me;
All discords hushed, my peace a river,
My soul, a prisoned bird set free.
[Chorus]
D:
Ife Re nikan, Oluwa mi,
Lo yi mi ka, to kun ‘nu mi
Alafia bi odo sisan,
Ti de si inu okan mi.
[Chorus]

C:
Shut in with Thee, O Lord, for ever,
My wayward feet no more to roam;
What power from Thee my soul can sever?
The center of God’s will my home.
[Chorus]
D:
Se mi mo ‘nu ife Re titi,
Ki nma sako lodo Re mo;
Tani le ya temi t’Oluwa?
Ninu ife Re ngo ma gbe.
[Chorus]

C:
Here in Thy name we are gathered,
Come and revive us, O Lord,
“There shall be showers of blessing”,
Thou hast declared in Thy word

Chorus:
Oh, graciously hear us,
Graciously hear us we pray;
Pour from Thy windows upon us
Showers of blessing to-day.
D:
Awa pejo l’Oruko Re,
Ran isoji Re si wa,
Je ki ojo ibukun ro,
Gege bi ileri Re.

Chorus:
Joo, gbo adura wa,
F’eti si aroye wa,
Si ferese orun sile;
Rojo ibukun loni.

C:
Oh! That the showers of blessings
Now on our souls may descend,
While at the footstool of mercy
Pleading Thy promise, we bend!
[Chorus]
D:
Je ki ojo ibukub Re
Ro si inu okan wa,
A wole nib’ite aanu,
A ro mo ileri Re.
[Chorus]

“Ojo ibukun y’o sir o”
Ileri na ko le ye’
“Wo ko le sai gbo ebe wa,
B’ati nf’ igbagbo bere.
[Chorus]

C:
Showers of blessings we need them,
Showers of blessings from Thee,
Showers of blessings oh, grant them
Thine all the glory shall be.
[Chorus]
D:
Ojo ibukun l’awa nfe,
Ojo lati oke wa;
Ojo ibukun, ran si wa,
Iwo l’a o f’ogofun.
[Chorus]

C:
Rich are the moments of blessings
Jesus my Saviour bestows;
Pure is the well of salvation
Fresh from His mercy that flows.

Chorus:
Ever He walketh beside me,
Brightly His sunshine appears
Spreading a beautiful rainbow
Over the valley of tears.
D:
Otun n’ibukun Oluwa,
T’o nda lu mi lojojo;
Mimo ni omi igbala,
T’o nfun mi mu lat’oke.

Chorus:
O mba mi gbe lojojulo,
Imole oju Re ntan;
O nfi owo-otun Re nu
Gbogbo omije mi nu.

C:
Rich are the moments of blessings
Lovely and hallowed and sweet,
When from my labour at noontide
Calmly I rest at His feet.
[Chorus]
D:
Otun n’ibukun Oluwa,
Didun ni lojojumo;
Lehin ise l’osanganagan,
Mo wasimi l’ese Re.
[Chorus]

C:
Why should I ever grow weary?
Why should I faint by the way?
Has he not promised to give me
Strength for the toils of the day?
[Chorus]
D:
Eese ti aare y’o mu mi,
Ti ngo si daku l’ona?
O seleri agbara Re,
Fun ise ojo kokan.
[Chorus]

C:
Though by the mist and the shadow
Sometimes my sky may be dim,
Rich are the moments of blessings
Spent in communion with Him.
[Chorus]
D:
B’isudede tab’ ikuku
Tile bo awosanma;
Otun n’ibukun Oluwa,
‘Gba mo ba gbadura si.
[Chorus]

Oluso-agutan kan mbe ti mo fe,
B’o ti nbukun mi, enu ko le so;
O t’eje Re sile, O si ku fun mi,
Ki mba le maa gbe n’nu ‘fe Re titi.

Chorus:
Ngo tele Jesu ni ojojumo,
Kos’ewu bi Jesu nsamona mi,
Ninu imole tab’okunkun;
Jesu Oluso-agutan y’o to mi.

C:
Pastures abundant doth His hand provide,
Still waters flowing ever at my side,
Goodness and mercy follow on my track,
With such a Shepherd nothing can I lack.
[Chorus]
D:
Opo onje l’o fi mbo okan mi,
S’ipa odo tutu l’O nto mi si;
Ire at’aanu Re y’o ma tele mi,
Ko s’ohun rere ti y’o fa sehin.
[Chorus]

C:
When I would wander from the path astray,
Then He will draw me back into the way;
In the darkest valley, I need fear no ill,
For, He, my Shepherd, will be with me still.
[Chorus]
D:
‘Gbat’a dan mi wo kin le sako lo,
O fi owo Re fa mi si agbo;
Ninu afonifoji nko ni beru,
Oluso-agutan mi wa pelu mi.
[Chorus]

C:
When labour’s ended and the journey done,
Then He will lead me safely to my home;
There I shall dwell in rapture sure and sweet,
With all the loved ones gathered round 
His feet.
[Chorus]
D:
‘Gbat’ ise mi l’aiye ba si pari,
‘Gbana y’o mu mi lo si ile mi,
‘Biti ngo maa gbe titi aiyeraiye,
Pel’ awon mimo l’eba ese Re.
[Chorus]

C:
What shall we offer our good Lord,
Poor nothings, for His boundless grace?
Fain would we His great name record
And worthily set forth His praise.
D:
Kil’ awa y’o fun Olorun
Fun gbogbo oore Re si wa?
Ao f’ayoranto ooko Re,
Ao si fi iyin Re han.

C:
Great object of our growing love,
To whom our more than all we owe,
Open the fountain from above,
And let it our full souls o’ erflow.
D:
Iwo li Olu ife wa;
L’odo Re l’a nr’ohun gbogbo’
Si orison lat’oke wa,
Jek’ o san si okan gbogbo.

C:
So shall our lives Thy power proclaim,
Thy grace for every sinner free;
Till all mankind shall learn Thy name,
Shall all stretch out their hands to Thee.
D:
Bel’ ao kede agbara Re,
At’ or’ ofe Re f’elese;
Titi gbogb’ eda y’o mo O,
Ti nwon o sit e ‘wo si O.

C:
Open a door which earth and hell
Mat strive to shut, but strive in vain;
Let thy word richly in us dwell,
And let our gracious fruit remain.
D:
Silekun sile fun ‘se Re,
T’aiye at’ Esu kio le see;
Je k’oro Re maa gbe ‘nu wa,
Ki eso re k’o wa titi.

C:
O multiply the sower’s seed!
And fruit we every hour shall bear,
Throughout the world Thy gospel spread,
Thy everlasting truth declare.
D:
‘Bukun eso afunrungbin!
K’a le maa so eso titi,
K’a tan ‘hinrere Re k’aiye,
Ati otito Re titi.

C:
We all, in perfect love renewed,
Shall know the greatness of Thy power,
Stand in the temple or our God
As pillars, and go out no more.
D:
Ao mo titobi ipa Re,
‘Gbat’ a ba se w ape n’ife;
Bi owon n’ile Olorun,
T’a o duro, t’a o ni jade mo.

Ibukun mbe ninu ise Oluwa,
Oso iyebiye li a nmu wa fun;
Ologbon l‘eni na ti ngba okan la,
Gba enikan la loni.

Chorus:
Gba enikan la loni,
L’oke ni ile ogo;
Ade ogo li ere wa l’ojo na,
Gba enikan la loni.

C:
In the quiet home-life showing love’s bright ray
More and more like Jesus living ev’ry day,
We may guide a dear one to the heavenward way,
He that winneth souls is wise.
[Chorus]
D:
Ninu ile re, maa tan
Maa fi ewa Jesu han nigbakugba,
A le t’ipa eyi gba enikan la,
Gba enikan la loni.
[Chorus]

C:
Out upon the highway, going forth with prayer,
For the lost ad straying, seeking everywhere,
Close beside the Shepherd, we His joy may share,
He that winneth souls is wise.
[Chorus]
D:
Jade lo kede li opopo ona,
Gbadura lati w’awon asako ri,
Mu ‘nu Oluwa dun ni fifa won wa;
Gba enikan la loni.
[Chorus]

C:
Sow beside all waters, sow the gospel seed,
Here a word in season, there a loving deeed,
Sinners to the saviour, be it ours to lead,
He that winneth souls is wise. 
[Chorus]
D:
Funrugbin oro na si ibi gbogbo,
Ni akoko t’o wo, wasu oro na,
Mu elese wa sodo Olugbala,
Gba enikan la loni.
[Chorus]

C:
Is your life a channel of blessing?
Is the love of God flowing through you?
Are you telling me the lost of the Saviour?
Are you ready His service to do?

Chorus:
Make me a channel of blessing today,
Make me a channel of blessing, I pray,
My life possessing, my service blessing,
Make me a channel of blessing today.
D:
O ha j’ohun elo ibukun?
Ife Olorun ha nsan si o?
O ha nso t’Olugbala f’elomi?
O ha mura lati sise?

Chorus:
Se mi l’ohun-elo loni, Baba,
Se mi l’ohun-elo emi mbe O;
Kun aiye mi, si bukun ise mi,
Se mi l’ohun-elo loni, Baba.

C:
Is your life a channel of blessing?
Are you burdened for those that are lost?
Have you urged upon those who are straying,
The Saviour who died on the cross.
[Chorus]
D:
O ha j’ohun-elo ibukun?
O na nronu t’awon ti nsegbe?
O ha nsipe fun awon ti nsako?
Lati w’Olugbala t’o ku.
[Chorus]

C:
Is your life a channel of blessing
Is it daily telling for Him?
Have you spoken the word of salvation
To those who are dying.
[Chorus]
D:
O ha j’ohun-elo ibukun?
Aiye re ha nso ti ife Re?
O ha ti soro igbala fun won?
Awon ti nku ninu ese.
[Chorus]

C:
We cannot be channels of blessings
If our lives are not free from all sin;
We will barriers be and a hindrance
To those we are trying to win.
[Chorus]
D:
A ko le je ohun-elo fun,
Bi ese ba njoba ninu wa;
Ohun ikose at’idigbolu,
L’ao je f’awon t’o yi wa ka.
[Chorus]

C:
Oh, where are the reapers that garner in
The sheaves of the good from the fields of sin?
With sickles of truth must the work be done
And no one may rest till the “harvest home”

Chorus:
Where are the reapers? Oh, who will come
And share in the glory of the “harvest home”?
Oh, who will help us to garner in
The sheaves of good from the fields of sin?
D:
Awon ti nkore s’inu aba da?
Awon ti nsa alikama s’oto?
Nwon mu doje otito l’owo won,
Nwon ko simi titi d’ojo ‘kore.

Chorus:
Olukore da? Tani y’o wa
Lati le pin ninu ayo ikore?
Tani y’o ba wa kojo s’aba
Lati ko alikama s’aba.

E lo si Abuja-ona pelu,
Alikama le wa larin epo;
Wa won li opopo ona pelu,
E ko won jo di ojo ikore.
[Chorus]

C:
The fields are all rip’ning and far and wide,
The world is awaiting the harvest tide,
But reapers are few, and the work is great,
And much will be lost should the harvest wait.
[Chorus]
D:
Oko na tip on tan fun ikore,
Aiye nduro de ojo ikore,
Ise po, alagbase ko to nkan,
Pupo ni y’o segbe bi a lora.
[Chorus]

C:
So come with your soldiers, ye sons of men,
And gather together the golden grain;
Toil on till the Lord of the harvest come,
Then share in the joy of the “harvest home”.
[Chorus]
D:
E dide, e mu doje nyin lowo,
Bere ise ti Oluwa ran yin;
Oluwa ikore fere de na,
Sise titi e o kore de ‘le.
[Chorus]

C:
Oh, how sweet to whisper of Jesus
And to tell the lost of One who died
That the vilest might be forgiven,
And to point them to Chorusist the crucified,
Oh, the joy that fills the spirit
When the tear is sparkling with delight,
As the soul goes into the glory
And the day passes grandly out of night.

Chorus: 
Oh, the precious name of Jesus,
It is beauty, fragrance and delight,
It is music, sweetness, and rapture,
‘Tis my song in the day and in the night.

Oh, how sweet to whisper of Jesus,
And to tell the wanderers of one
Who can lead them back to the Father,
On the path which His sorrows great have won.
Of the bells that ring up yonder,
Of the joy that fills the soul in bliss,
When the lost are home with the Father,
Oh, there’s no joy that will compare with this.
[Chorus]
D:
O ti dun to lati rohin Re,
Lati so ti Jesu f’elomi;
Lati yo awon ti nsegbe lo,
Lati mu won pada sodo Baba,
Ti ayo larin angeli
At’ayo ‘gbala n’nu elese;
“Gbati asako pada wa ‘le,
Ko si ayo t’a le fi we eyi.
[Chorus]

C:
By and by this whisper of Jesus
Will be changed to shouts that rend the sky
As a king He’s coming to own us
Where He came once to suffer and to die,
All these wanderers will be with Him,
And will make His triumph hour complete,
And will swell the loud hallelujah
We shall sing when our glorious Lord we meet.

O, there’s no sorrow in heaven,
No part-ing and no good-by,
To those with sins all for-given,
There’ll be no tears in the sky.

Chorus:
No sorrow is found in that city,
No heartache and no good-bye
For all will be bright in that city of light.
For there are no tears in the sky.
D:
Ibanuje ko si l’orun,
Beni ko si ipinya;
Fun awon t’a ti dariji,
Ekun ki y’o si l’orun.

Chorus: 
Ibanuje ko si ni ‘lu na,
Beni ailera ko si;
‘Tori gbogbo ilu na je imole,
“Tori ekun ko si l’orun.

C:
O, there’s no sad dis-ap-apoint-ment
No eyes fill’d with tears to dry,
For there will be no glad con-tent-ment,
There are no tears in the sky.
[Chorus]
D:
Aisedede ko si nibe,
Ko s’oju t’o n’ omije;
‘Tori itelorun y’o wa,
Ekun ki y’o si l’orun.
 Ibanuje ko si ni ‘lu na, &c.

C:
Up there, no hearts that are broken,
There, no one to breathe a sigh,
No un-kind word will be spo-ken,
There’ll be no more tears in the sky.
[Chorus]
D:
Ko si ‘robinuje l’oke,
Ko si si imi-edun,
A ki yo s’oro kikoro,
Ekun ki y’o si l’orun.
 Ibanuje ko si ni ‘lu na, &c.

C:
Here, hearts are sorrow’d by dad-ness,
For lov’d ones and friends must die,
But there is sunshine and glad-ness,
There’ll be no tears in the sky.
[Chorus]
D:
‘Banuje kun okan nihin,
‘Tori ipinya ti mbe;
Sugbon ayo l’o wa l’ohun,
Ekun ki y’o si l’orun.
 Ibanuje ko si ni ‘lu na

C:
When all my labors and trials are ‘o’ er,
And I am safe on that beautiful shore,
Just to be near the dear Lord I adore,
Will thro’ the ages be glory for me.

Chorus:  
O will be glory for me
Glory for me, glory for me,
When by His grace I shall look on His face,
That will be glory, be glory for me.
D:
“Gbat’ ise on ‘danwo mi ba pari,
Ti mo si gun s’ebute rere na;
Ki nsa le sunm’ Oluwa ti mo fe,
Eyi y’o je ogo fun mi titi.

Chorus:
Eyi y’o je ogo fun mi,
Ogo fun mi, ogo fun mi;
Ti ngo w’oju Re nipa or’ofe,
Eyi y’o je ogo fun mi.

C:
When, by the gift of His infinite grace,
I am accorded in Heaven a place,
Just to be there and to look on His face,
Will thro’ ages be glory for me.
[Chorus]
D:
Nigba ore-ofe Re ailopin,
Ba fi ipo kan li orun fun mi;
Ki nsa le wa nbe lati w’oju Re,
Eyi y’o je ogo fun mi titi.
     Eyi y’o je ogo fun mi &c.

C:
Friends will be there I have loved long ago,
Joy like a river around me will flow,
Yet, just a smile from my Saviour, I know,
Will thro’ the ages be glory for me.
[Chorus]
D:
Ore ti mo fe y’o wa nibe,
Ayo bi odo y’o san yi mi ka;
Mo mo pen go r’ayo lodo Jesu,
Eyi y’o je ogo fun mi titi.
     Eyi y’o je ogo fun mi &c

C:
There is singing up in heaven such as we
Have never known,
Where the angels sing the praises of the 
Lamb upon the throne,
Their sweet harps are ever tuneful and
Their voices always clear,
Oh, that we might be more like them
While we serve the Master here.

Chorus: 
Holy, holy, is what the angels sing
And I expect to join them make the courts Of heaven ring;
But when I sing redemption’s story they will fold their wings,
For angels never felt the joys that our Salvation brings.
D:
Orin mbe li orun iru eyiti awa ko mo,
Nibiti awon Angeli nkorin ‘yin s’Odagutan;
Harpu won ni ohun didun, ohun won si dun pelu,
A! ki awa le se bi ti won lati sin Oluwa.

Chorus:
Mimo, Mimo l’awon Angeli nko,
Mo si ni ireti lati ba won korin li Orun;
Sugbon won ko le ba mi korin ti irapada
‘Tori Angeli ko mo ayo ti ‘gbala mu wa.

C:
But I hear another anthem, blending
Voices clear and strong,
“Unto Him who hath redeem’ d us and
Hath bought us” is the song;
We have come thro’ tribulations to this
Land so fair and bright,
In the Fountain freely flowing He hath
Made our garments white.
[Chorus]
D:
Sugbon mo gbo orin miran ti a ko l’ohun oke,
“Si enit’ O ra wa pada t’O si gba wa: l’orin na
Awa ti la iponju ja wa si ile didan yi,
Nibi orisun iye tin san l’o ti fo aso wa mo.
     Mimo, Mimo l’awon Angeli nko &c.

C:
Then the angels stand and listen, for they
Cannot join that song,
Like the sound of many waters, by that
Happy, blood-wash’ ed throng;
For they sing about great trials, battles
fought and vict’ries won,
And they praise their great Redeemer
who hath said to them “well done”.
[Chorus]
D:
Awon Angeli dake tori won ko le korin na,
Bi iro omi pupo l’enu awon t’a f’eje ra!
Tori won nso ti isegun lori ‘danwo at’ija,
Nwon si nyin Olurapada ti o ti wipe ‘O seun
     Mimo, Mimo l’awon Angeli nko &c.

C:
So, although I’ m not an angel, yet I know
that over there
I will join a blessed chorus that the
angels cannot share
I will sing about my Saviour, who upon
dark Calvary,
freely pardon’d my transgressions, died
to set a sinner free. 
[Chorus]
D:
Bi emi ko tile nse Angeli, mo mo pe l’ohun,
Ngo b’awon mimo korin t’awon Angeli ko ni ko;
Ngo korin ti Olugbala ti o ku ni Kalfari,
Lati dari ese mi ji mi, lati da mi sile.
     Mimo, Mimo l’awon Angeli nko &c.

C:
There’s a land of peace and plenty,
And its gates are open wide,
And the pure in heart and holy,
In its shelter may abide,
It is not thro’ gates of glory
That a soul must enter in;
But all who would find entrance there
Must leave the ways of sin.

Chorus: 
Come over, come over
To the land of corn and wine;
There nothing can compare
With the many holy pleasures there;
Come over, come over,
Leave the desert plain below
And come away, away, Come over.
D:
Ile Alafia kan wa, ti ‘lekun re si sile,
Eniti okan re funfun ti o si mo, y’o gbe ‘be,
K’ise enu ona ogo nikan l’a nib a wo’le;
Sugbon eniti y’o wo ‘be y’o k’ese sile na.

Chorus:
Wa nihin, wa nihin, si ‘le eletu-loju;
Ko s’ohun t’a le fi we adun mimo ti o wa nibe,
Wa nihin, wa nihin, fi asale yi sile,
Si jade wa, jade, jade wa..

C:
There is bread of heaven growing,
In its fair and  fertile fields
And the wine of love its vineyard
To the thirsting mortal yields;
There are mountain heights of glory
That await the trav’ler’s rod,
And blest retreats where empty souls
Draw nearer unto God.
[Chorus]
D:
Irugbin orun nhu nibe, ni ‘le’re ti o l’ora,
O si nhu igi ajara ti o ntu okan l’ara;
Oke giga, didan wa mbe t’o je ibi itura,
Aabo t’ o daju ni o je f’okan t’o sunmo O.
    Wa nihin, wa nihin, si ‘le eletu-loju; &c.

C:
Who would stay without its borders,
In the desert dark and drear,
When the luscious grapes of Eschol
Are so very, very near?
Enter in then with rejoicing,
For the Lord is on your side,
And in his glorious presence
Evermore you shall abide. 
[Chorus]
D:
Tani ko fe lo sile na t’o fe joko s’asale,
“Gbati eso ile na pon ti ‘be si wa nitosi?
Nje fi ayo wo ile tori Oluwa mbe fun o,
Niwaju ‘te ogo Re, ni ‘wo o ma gbe titi.
    Wa nihin, wa nihin, si ‘le eletu-loju &

C:
Let me be with Thee where Thou art,
My Saviour, my eternal rest;
Then only will this longing heart
Be fully and for ever blest.
D:
Je ki m’ ni ‘po mi lodo Re,
Jesu, iwo isimi mi;
‘Gbana l’okan mi y’o simi,
Y’o si ri ekun ‘bukun gba.

C:
Let me be with Thee where Thou art,
Thy unveil’d glory to behold;
Then only will this wandering heart
Cease to be treacherous, faithless, cold.
D:
Je ki m’ ni ‘po mi lodo Re,
K’emi k’o le ri ogo Re;
‘Gbana ni okan etan mi
Yio ri eni f’ara le.

C:
Let me be with Thee where Thou art,
Where spotless saints Thy name adore,
Then only will this sinful heart
Be evil and defiled no more.
D:
Je ki m’ nip o mi lodo Re,
Nibi awon mimo nyin O;
‘Gbana ni okan ese mi,
Y’o dekun ese ni dida.

C:
Let me be with Thee where Thou art,
Where none can die, where none remove
There neither death nor life will part.
Me from Thy presence and Thy love.
D:
Jeki m’ ni’po mi lodo Re,
Nibi a ki yipo pada;
Nib’ a ko npe, O digbose,
Titi aiye, titi aiye.

C:
Jerusalem, my happy home,
Name ever dear to me,
When shall my labors have an end
In joy, and peace, and thee?
D:
Jerusalem ibi ayo,
T’o se owon fun mi,
‘Gbawo n’ise mi o pari,
L’ayo l’ alafia.

C:
When shall these eyes thy heaven-built walls,
And pearly gates behold,
Thy bulwarks with salvation strong,
And streets of shining gold?
D:
‘Gbawo ni oju mi y’o ri,
Enu-bode pearl Re?
Odi Re to le fun ‘gbala,
Ita wura didan.

C:
There happier bowers than Eden’s bloom,
Nor sin nor sorrow know:
Blest seats through rude and stormy scenes
I onward press to you.
D:
‘Gbawo ilu Olorun mi,
L’emi o d’afin Re?
Nibiti ijo ki tuka,
Nib’ ayo ailopin.

C:
Why should I shrink from pain and woe
Or feel at death dismay?
I’ve Canaan’s goodly land in view,
And realms of endless day.
D:
Eese t’emi o ko iya,
Iku at’ iponju?
Mo now ile rere Kenaan,
Ile ‘mole titi.

C:
Apostles, martyrs, prophets, there
Around my Saviour stand,
And soon my friend in Christ below
Will join the glorious band.
D:
Aposteli  martir, woli,
Nwon y’Olugbala ka;
Awa tikara wa, fere,
Dapo mo ogun na.

C:
Jerusalem, my happy home,
My soul still pants for thee;
Then shall my labors have an end
When I thy joys shall see.
D:
Jerusalem ilu ayo,
Okan mi nfa si O;
‘Gbati mo ba ri ayo Re,
Ise mi y’o pari.

C:
The Lord’s our rock, in Him we hide;
A shelter, in the time of storm!
Secure whatever all betide
A shelter in the time of storm!

Chorus:
Oh, Jesus is a Rock in a weary land!
A weary land; a weary land;
Oh, Jesus is a Rock in a weary land,
A shelter in the time of storm !
D:
Oluwa li Apata wa,
Lodo Re l’awa o sa si;
Ohunkohun t’o wu ko de
Abo ninu iji ‘ponju.

Chorus:
Jesu li Apata f’awon alaare,
Fun alaare, fun alaare;
Jesu li Apata f’awon alaare,
Abo ninu iji ‘ponju.

Abo l’o je fun wa l’osan,
Olugbeja wa ni l’oru;
Ota ko le deruba wa,
Abo ninu iji ‘ponju.
[Chorus]

C:
The raging storms may round us beat;
A shelter in the time of storm!
We’ll never leave our safe retreat,
A shelter in the time of storm!
[Chorus]
D:
Ija nla le ja yi wa ka,
Ikun omi le n’de si wa;
A ti r’ibit’a o sa si,
Abo ninu iji ‘ponju.
[Chorus]

C:
O rock divine, O refuge dear;
A shelter in the time of storm!
Be thou our helper ever near,
A shelter in the time of storm!
[Chorus]
D:
Apata aiyeraiye wa,
Ilu abo wa t’o s’owon;
Sunmo wa lati se ‘ranwo,
Abo ninu iji ‘ponju
[Chorus]

C:
Sometimes a light surprises
The Christian while he sings;
It is the Lord who rises
With healing in His wings;
When comforts are declining,
He grants the soul again
A season of clear shining,
To cheer it after rain.

D:
Ohun t’o wu k’o mu wa,
On y’o mu wa laaja;
O nwo ewwko l’aso,
At’awon enia Re:
L’abe awosanma Re,
Ko s’enit’ ebi npa;
Eni mbo awon eiye,
Y’o f’omo Re l’onje.

C:
Though vine nor fig-tree neither
Their wonted fruit should bear
Though all the field should wither
Not flocks nor herds be there,
Yet, God the same abiding,
His praise shall tune my voice
For, while in Him confiding,
I cannot but rejoice.

O Christ, in Thee my soul hath found,
And found in Thee alone,
The peace, the joy I sought so long,
The bliss till now unknown.

Chorus:
Now none but Christ can satisfy
None other name for me,
There’s love and life and lasting joy,
Lord Jesus found in Thee.
D:
Ninu Kristi, okan mi ri
Alafia didun,
Isimi ti okan mi nfe,
Ayo yi nko ni ri.

Chorus:
Lodo Krist’ n’itelorun wa,
Ko s’Oruko bi Re;
Iye, ife, ayo kikun,
N’nu Jesu l’a le ri.

C:
I sighed for rest and happiness,
I yearned for them, not Thee
But while I passed my Saviour by,
His love laid hold on me.
[Chorus]
D:
Mo nwa isimi kakiri,
Sugbon nko wa Jesu;
Bi mo ti nkoja lara Re,
Be lo fi ‘fe fa mi.
[Chorus]

C:
I tried the broken cistern, Lord,
But, ah! the waters failed
E’en as I stooped to drink they fled,
And mocked me as I wailed.
[Chorus]
D:
Mo mu omi kanga aiye,
Ongbe tun ngbe mi si;
Gba mo nsofo ti mo nsokun,
Aiye nfi mi rerin.
[Chorus]

C:
The pleasure lost I sadly mourned,
But never wept for Thee;
Till grace my sightless eyes received,
Thy loveliness to see. 
[Chorus]
D:
Mo banuje ‘tori aiye,
Lai ronu nipa Re;
Tit’ or’ofe mu mi ki nri
Ewa at’ife Re.
[Chorus]

C:
I have found His grace is all complete,
He supplieth every need;
While I sit and learn at Jesus’ feet,
I am free, yes, free indeed.
Chr: It is joy unspeakable and full of glory
Full of glory, full of glory
It is joy unspeakable and full of glory
Oh, the half has never yet been told.
D:
Mo ti de ile ore-ofe,
O to fun gbogb’ aini mi;
Nigbati mo joko l’ese Re,
O so mi d’ominira.

Chorus:
Ayo nla ni, ayo ti Jesu nfifun ni,
Ayo ti enu ko le so;
Ayo nla ni ayo ti o kun fun ogo,
Ayo ti a ko le rohin tan.

C:
I have found pleasure I once craved
It is joy and peace within;
What a wondrous blessing! I am saved 
From the awful gulf of sin.
D:
Mo ti de ile igbadun nla,
Alafia ninu mi;
Ibukun ti o kunwonsile,
Mo bo lowo ese mi.
[Chorus]

C:
I have found that hope so bright and clear,
Living in the realm of grace;
Oh, the Saviour’s presence is so near
I can see His smiling face.
D:
Mo ti ni ireti t’o daju,
Ninu ore-ofe Re,
Olugbala mi mbe pelu mi,
O nrerin si omo Re.
[Chorus]

C:
I have found the joy no tongue can tell
How its waves of glory roll!
It is like a great o’erflowing well
Springing up within my soul
D:
Mo l’ayo tie nu ko le so,
Ogo ayo na npo si;
Bi kanga om’iye ninu mi,
“Jojumo l’o nru soke.
[Chorus]

C:
Who can cheer the heart like Jesus, 
By His presence all divine?   
True and tender, pure and precious, 
O how blest to call Him mine!   

Chorus: All that thrills my soul is Jesus;   
He is more than life to me;   
And the fairest of ten thousand,   
In my blessed Lord I see.
D:
Tal’ o le mu okan mi yo
Olugbala, lehin Re?
Olooto at’ Oninure,
Mo yo pe ‘Wo di t’emi.

Chorus:
Jesu nikan l’o nmu mi yo,
O ju ohu gbogbo lo;
Enit’ okan mi nfe julo,
Ni Jesu Oluwa mi.

C:
Love of Christ so freely given.   
Grace of God beyond degree,   
Mercy higher than the heaven,   
Deeper then the deepest sea.

What a wonderful redemption!   
Never can a mortal know   
How my sin, tho' red like crimson,   
Can be whiter than the snow.
D:
A! irapada, iyanu
Ti enia ko le mo;
Ese mi to pon b’ododo,
O we mi, mo di mimo.

C:
Every need His hand supplying,   
Every good in Him I see;   
On His strength divine relying,   
He is all in all to me.
D:
O npese fun gbogb’ aini wa,
Orisun ebun rere;
Agbara Re l’o ngbe mi ro,
O j’ohun gbogbo fun mi.
[Chorus]

C:
By the crystal flowing river   
With the ransomed I will sing,   
And forever and forever   
Praise and glorify the King.
D:
L’eba odo t’o mo gara,
Ngo b’awon mimo Ko rin;
‘Biti nwon nfi ‘yin f’Oba wa,
Tit’aiye ainipekun
[Chorus]

C:
It is glory just to walk with Him 
Him whose blood has ransomed me;
It is rapture for my soul each day.
It is joy divine to feel Him near where'er my path may be. 
Bless the Lord, it's glory all the way!
Chorus:
It is glory just to walk with Him.
It is glory just to walk with Him.
He will guide my steps aright,
Through the vale and o'er the height.
It is glory just to walk with Him.
D:
O ti dun to lati mo Jesu enit’o gba mi la,
‘Jojumo okan mi nkun f’ayo;
Ayo ni lati rip e O mba mi li sibikibi,
‘Jojumo ogo ni f’Oluwa.

Chorus:
 O ti dun to lati maa baa rin
 O ti dun to lati maa baa rin
 Y’o maa se Amona mi n’nu ‘mole
      at’okunkun;
 o ti dun to lati maa baa rin.

C:
It is glory when the shadows fall, 
To know that He is near.
Oh, what joy to simply trust and pray!
It is glory to abide in Him when skies above are clear.
Yes, with Him, it's glory all the way!
D:
O ti dun to ki O wa nitosi nigba idanwo,
K’a sa gbagbo k’a si gbadura;
O ti dun to ki a maa gbe ninu Krist’
     Nigbakugba,
Y’o maa fi ogo orun kun wa.
[Chorus]

C:
Twill be glory when I walk with Him on heaven's golden shore,
Never from His side again to stray.
Twill be glory, wondrous glory with the Saviour evermore,
Everlasting glory all the way!
D:
Y’o ti dun to lati pade Re l’ebute Ogo na.
Awa y’o pade l’aipinya mo;
Orin ogo, ogo, ogo, l’a o ma ko titi lai,
Ni ilu Ologo ti Baba.
[Chorus]

C:
Jesus the Savior, dying on Calv’ry,
Purchased my pardon, setting me free.
Love so abundant, should I not serve Him,
When He so gladly suffered for me?
Chorus:
Lord, I am Thine, Savior divine,
Oh what a joy
Just to know, Thou art mine.
D:
Jesu t’O ku fun mi ni Kalfari,
T’o ra ‘dariji fun mi l’ofe;
Mo ha le se ife to po bayi?
Ki nma sise f’enit’o ra mi?

Chorus:
Tire l’emi, Olugbala,
A! ayo nla pe Iwo je temi.

C:
Oh, what a Savior, tender and loving,
Guarding my footsteps lest I should stray;
Love so abundant, leading me ever,
Out of the darkness into the day.
D:
Olugbala t’o fe mi l’afetan,
T’o nto ‘sise mi  kin ma sako;
Titi d’oni O nse Amona mi,
Lat’ inu okunkun s’imole.
[Chorus]

C:
Constant companion, leaving me never,
Bidding me follow close by Thy side;
He is my refuge, safely I shelter,
Knowing He loves me, whate’er betide.
D:
Ore kori kosun l’oje fun mi,
O nfa mi ki nsunmo odo Re;
Odi at’abo l’o je fun mi,
Mo mo, O fe mi titi d’opin.
[Chorus]

C:
Once I thought I walked with Jesus,
Yet such changeful feelings had,
Sometimes trusting, sometimes doubting,
Sometimes joyful, sometimes sad.

Chorus
Oh the peace my Saviour gives,
Peace I never knew before!
For my way has brighter grown
Since I learned to trust him more.
D:
Lekan mo ‘pe mo nsin Jesu,
Sugb’okan mi ko bale;
‘Gbagbo mi ndaku o ndaji,
Mo ndide, mo si nsubu.

Chorus:
Ibale okan didun,
Eyi ti nko mo tele;
Imole Re ntan si mi,
‘Gbati mo gbeke mi le.

C:
For He called me closer to him,
Bade by doubting tremors cease,
And, when I had fully trusted,
Filled my soul with perfect peace.
D:
O pe mi ki nsunmo tosi,
O le ‘yemeji mi lo,
Bi mo si ti gbeke mi le,
Be ni mo r’alafia.
[Chorus]

C:
Now I'm trusting every moment,
Less than this is not enough;
And my Saviour bears me gently
O'er the places once so rough.
D:
‘Jojumo ni mo ngbekele,
Agbara mi ko to nkan;
Oluwa mil’O si ngbe mi
Leke gbogbo isoro.

C:
Blessèd Savior, Thou dost keep me
By Thy power from day to day,
And my heart is full of gladness,
For Thou’lt keep me all the way

Peace Like A River Is Flooding My Soul.
Since Christ My Saviour, maketh Me Whole;
Sweet Peace Abiding My Portion Shall Be
Jesus, My Saviour, Is Precious To Me.
Pre…cious To Me… 
Pre…cious Is He…
Jesus Shall Ever… Be Pre…cious ToMe.
D:
Alafia de s’inu okan mi,
‘Gbati Jesu gba okan mi la;
Alafia yi y’o maa ba mi gbe,
Jesu Oluwa mi s’owon fun mi.

Chorus:
Jesu s’owon, s’owon fun mi,
Titi lai ni yio na sowon fun mi.

C:
Joy Is Abounding - My Heart daily Sings
Cleave I The Heavens, Mount Up On Wings
Christ Hath Exalted, My Soul He Set Free
Jesus, My Saviour, Is Precious To Me.
D:
Ayo bi odo nla nsan ninu mi.
Mo mko’rin, mo si nf’ iye goke;
Kristi so okan mi di ominira,
Jesu Oluwa mi s’owon fun mi.
[Chorus]

C:
Oh, Precious Jesus, How Lovely Thou Art
Come And Abiding Rule In My Heart
Break Ev’ry Fetter. Thy Face Let Me See
Then Thou Shalt Ever Be Precious To Me.
D:
Jesu Oluwa, mo ti fe O to!
Wole, si maa joba ninu mi;
Ja gbogbo ide ki nle r’oju Re,
‘Gbana’ Wo o s’owon fun mi titi.    
[Chorus]

C:
Let us sing of His love once again
Of the Love that can never decay,
Of the blood of the Lamb who was slain,
Till we praise Him again in that day

Chorus:
In the sweet by and by,
We shall meet on that beautiful shore (2ce)
D:
Je k’a tunko orin ife Re,
Ife ti ko le ku titi lai;
Orin nipa eje t’o raw a,
K’a yin l’ogo titi d’ojo na.

Chorus:
Pel’ayo …. nigbose,
L’ao pade l’ebute didan na;
Pel’ayo …. nigbose 
L’ao pade l’ebute didan na.

C:
There are cleansing and healing for all
Who will wash in the life-giving flood;
 There is life everlasting and joy
At the right hand of God through the blood.
[Chorus]

Even now while we taste of His love
We are filled with delight at His name;
But what will it be when above
We shall join in the song of the Lamb.
[Chorus]
D:
Nihin, a ngbadura ife nla yi,
Itowo ayo na ti dun to;
Sugbon t’ohun ni y’o dun julo,
‘Gbat’ ao maa b’awon mimo
    Korin. 
[Chorus]

C:
There’s a land that is fairer than day,
And by faith we can see it afar;
For the father waits over the way,
To prepare us a dwelling-place there.

Chorus:
In the sweet by and by
We shall meet on that beautiful shore (2ce)
D:
Ile kan mbe t’o dara julo,
A le f’igbagbo ri ile na;
Nibiti Baba nduro de wa,
Lati fun wa n’ibugbe nibe.

Chorus:
Pel’ayo …. nigbose,
L’ao pade l’ebute didan na;
Pel’ayo …. Nigbose,
L’ao pade l’ebute didan na.

C:
We shall sing on that beautiful shore
The melodious songs of the blest,
And our spirits shall sorrow no more,
Not a sigh for the blessing of rest.
[Chorus]
D:
Ao korin l’ebute didan na,
Orin t’awon alabukunfun;
Ko ni s’ibanuje fun wa mo,
Kiki ‘simi didun at’ayo.
[Chorus]

C:
To our bountiful Father above,
We will offer our tribute of praise,
For the glorious gift of His love,
And the blessing, that hallow our days.
[Chorus]
D:
Ao korin iyin si Baba wa,
Fun ore-ofe Re lori wa;
Fun ebun ofe ti Omo Re,
At’ibukun t’o ko le ka tan.
[Chorus]

C:
There’s a land of pure delight
Where saints immortal reign,
Infinite day excludes the night,
And pleasures banish pain.

Chorus:
We’re feeding on the living Bread,
We’re drinking at the fountain-head;
And who so drinketh, Jesus said,
Shall never, never thirst again.
What! Never thirst again?
No, never thirst again!
And whoso drinketh, Jesus said,
Shall never, never thirst again!
D:
Ile ayo kikun kan mbe,
‘Bit’awon mimo ngbe;
Ko s’oru af’osan titi:
Irora ko si n’be.

Chorus:
 Onje iye li awa nje,
 Kanga iye li awa nmu;
 Enit’o ba mu kanga yi,
Ongbe ki y’o gbe mo lailai
      Bayi ni Jesu wi,
 “Ongbe ki y’o gbe mo”
 Enit’ o ba mu kanga yi,
 Ongbe ki y’o gbe mo lailai.

C:
There everlasting spring abides,
And never-withering flowers:
Death, like a narrow sea, divides
This heavenly land from ours
[Chorus]
D:
Orisun iye mbe nibe,
Itanna ti ki re,
Iku n’iboji ti ko je,
K’a r’ile ewa yi.
[Chorus]

C:
O could we make our doubts remove
Those gloomy thoughts that rise,
And see the Canaan that we love
With ubeclouded eyes.
[Chorus]
D:
‘Yemeji wa ‘ba le fo lo,
K’a le aigbagbo lo;
K’a f’igbagbo wo Kenaan wa,
Ile wara, oyin. 
[Chorus]

C:
Could we but climb where Moses stood
And view the landscape o’er
Not Jordan’s stream, nor death‘s cold flood,
Should fright us from the shore.
[Chorus]
D:
A ba le goke bi Mose,
K’a wo ‘le na lookan;
Iku bi odo nla Jordan,
K’y’o deruba wa mo.   
[Chorus]

C:
Who, who are these beside the chilly wave,
Just on the borders of the silent grave,
Shouting Jesus’ power to save,
“Washed in the blood of the Lamb”?

Chorus:
“Sweeping through the gates” of
the New Jerusalem,
“Washed in the blood of the Lamb
D:
Tali awon wonyi ti o duro
Pelu ‘mo ‘pe isegun l’owo won?
A we won n’nu eje Jesu,
Nwon nyin Odo-agutan.

Chorus:
Nwon nro wo ‘bode Jerusalem titun na,
A we won n’n’eje Jesu;
Nwon nro wo ‘bode Jerusalem titun na,
A we won n’n’eje Jesu.

C:
These, these are they who, in their
youthful days,
Found Jesus early, and in wisdom’s ways
Proved the fullness of His grace,
“Washed in the blood of the Lamb”
[Chorus]
D:
Awon wonyi ni, nigba aiye won,
Ranti Oluwa nigba ewe won;
Nwon ri ore-ofe gba,
A we won n’n’eje Jesu
[Chorus]

C:
These, these are they who, in affliction’s woes,
Ever have found in Jesus calm repose,
Such as from a pure heart flows,
“Washed in the blood of the Lamb”.
D:
Awon wonyi ni, nigba iponju,
F’ara mo Jesu fun iranlowo;
Awon olokan funfun,
A we won n’n’eje Jesu.
[Chorus]

C:
These, these are they who, in the conflict dire,
Boldly have stood amid the hottest fire,
Jesus now says: “Come up higher,”
“Washed in the blood of the Lamb”.
[Chorus]
D:
Awon wonyi farada isoro,
N’ija kikoro, nwon je akoni;
Jesu pe won sodo Re,
A we won n’n’eje Jesu.
[Chorus]

C:
Safe, safe upon the ever-shining shore,
Sin, pain, and death, and sorrow all are o’er,
Happy now and evermore,
“Washed in the blood of the Lamb”. 
[Chorus]
D:
Nwon ti gunle si ebute ogo,
Iku at’ese ko le joba mo;
Nisi, nwon nyo titi lai,
A we won n’n’eje Jesu.
[Chorus]

C:
I shall see the king
Where the angels sing,
I shall see the King some day,
In the better land,
On the golden strand,
And with Him shall ever stay.

Chorus:
In His glory, I shall see the King,
And for ever endless praise sing;
‘Twas on Calvary Jesus died for me;
I shall see the King some day.
D:
Ngo ri Oba mi larin Angeli,
Ngo ri Oba l’ojo kan;
Nile to dara, ni ilu wura,
Ngo ma gbe nibe titi.

Chorus:
Ngo ri Oba ninu ogo Re,
Ngo ma korin iyin si titi;
Krist’ ti Kalfari ti O ku fun mi,
Ngo ri Oba l’ojo kan.

C:
In the land of song,
In the glory thron
Where there never comes a night,
With my Lord once slain
I shall ever reign
In the glory land of light.
[Chorus]
D:
N’ilu ayo na, n’ilu ogo na,
Nibiti oru ko si;
Ngo ba Oluwa mi joba titi,
N’ilu ogo didan na.
[Chorus]

C:
I shall see the King,
All my tributes bring,
And shall look upon His face;
Then my song shall be
How we ransomed me,
And has kept me by His grace
[Chorus]
D:
Ngo ri Oba  mi, ngo si wole fun,
Ngo tejumo ogo Re;
Ngo korin ore-ofe to ra mi,
To pa mi mo de opin.
[Chorus]

C:
We-give-Thee thanks- dear-Jesus-Christ
For call-ing-us-as-Apostles
That-you-gave power o’er all problems
Over-all manners of illness.

Chorus:
Free-ly, free-ly you have received
Free-ly, free-ly give
Go in my name and because you believe
Others will know that I live.
D:
A-yin-O Jesu Kristi fun,
Pe O pe wa b’O ti p’awon;
Aposteli ‘gbani t’o f’a
Gba-ra fun won lo-ri aisan.

Chorus:
Li-ofe li-ofe la-fi fun yin,
L’ofe ni k’e fi fun ni;
Lo l’Oruko mi ‘tori o’gbagbo,
K’elomiran le gba-gbo.

C:
Over-all-spirits-of-satan
To heal-all-diverse-diseases
To-raise-the dead that have no hope
And make all lepers ever clean.
[Chorus]
D:
A-ti emi esu la-ti
Se ‘wo-san gbogb’ arun ati
Aisan la-ti j’oku di-de,
La-ti s-adete di mimo.
[Chorus]

C:
Now that-we’ve-heard-Thy calling-Lord
To-preach-Thy word-o’er all the earth
And-hold-this-faith till Thee we see
O-Lord we pray-help-us-through-this.
[Chorus]
D:
Nje b’a ti je ‘pe re Jesu,
La-ti wa-su ‘hinrere Re;
Ka ki-ri gbo-gbo a – gba – ye,
Jo-wo ran wa lo-wo Je-su
[Chorus]

C:
Give us Thy power as Apostles’ time,
To do Thy work as commanded;
And when Thou come to reign again
That we might all re-joice with Thee.
[Chorus]
D:
Fun-wa la-gba-ra bi t’awon
Aposteli ti i-gba ni,
Fun i-se na k’a sib a O
Jogun iye ai-nipekun.
[Chorus]
